La  Señora Marta tiene 61 años de edad, está casada, reside en compañía de su esposo y una hija en el Municipio de Nueva Frontera, Departamento de Santa Barbará.
Doña Marta inicio su negocio de pulpería hace 6 años con el fin de obtener ingresos para contribuir a la economía del hogar. Ella vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como: granos básicos, lácteos, verduras, golosinas y refrescos.
En la actualidad doña Marta ha solicitado un crédito por la cantidad de 5,000 Lempiras, los que invertirá adquiriendo productos para surtir su pulpería.
Ella considera que el préstamo le ayudara a aumentar sus ventas, ya que dispondrá de variedad de productos alimenticios.
Sus metas son crecer en su negocio manteniéndolo bien surtido  y sacar adelante su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Marta is 61 years old. She is married and resides with her husband and daughter in the town of Nueva Frontera, Department of Santa Barbará.

Doña Marta started his grocery business six years ago so that she could generate income and contribute to the household finances. She sells basic household products such as basic grains, dairy products, vegetables, snacks, and soft drinks.

At the moment, Doña Marta is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 HNL to invest in the acquisition of products to restock her store. She believes the loan will help to increase her sales by having a variety of food products available. Her goals are to grow her business and keep it well-stocked so that she can move her family forward.

loans.use: to buy rice, lard, beans, sugar, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Наталья  - фермер. С 1982 года она выращивает клубнику, подсолнух, арбуз.
По хозяйству ей помогает муж и двое детей, 29-ти и 27-ти лет. Младшая дочка работает преподавателем в мединституте.
Развитие сельскохозяйственной деятельности начиналось с высадки арбузов, на паевых землях.
Для перекрытия  старой  теплицы, в которой Наталья выращивает клубнику, необходима пленка.
В планах на будущее:  установить теплицу для выращивания винограда.
В личных планах Наталья планирует приобрести автомобиль для транспортировки товара на рынок.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования  пленки для теплицы.
texts.en: Nataliya is a farmer.  She has been growing strawberries, sunflowers and watermelons since 1982.  Her husband and two children, who are 29 and 27 years old, help her with the business.  The youngest daughter works as a teacher at a medical institute.  The development of the agricultural business started with planting watermelons on mutual lands.  Nataliya needs plastic to cover an old greenhouse, where she grows strawberries.  Her future plans are to install a greenhouse for growing grapes.  Her personal plans are to purchase a car for transporting product to a market.  Nataliya needs your help to finance the plastic for the greenhouse.

loans.use: to purchase plastic for a greenhouse

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in Changamwe area of Coast province, Kenya. He is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. He owns a transport business which he has been operating for three years. He offers transport service to the residents of Changamwe.

He learned about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group, and he joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. The challenges is, there is high rate of theft of motorcycles and high fuel costs.

Joseph is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenyan shillings to expand the business by buying another motorcycle. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family. His plan for the future is to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is a fish monger in Asafora near Cape Coast. She buys fresh fish from the market to fry and then sell. She has done this for 10 years. She is married to a farmer and has 7 children. She uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their family. Efua will use her loan to purchase more fresh fish to fry and sell. With the new profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to fry and sell.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a very cheerful lady and is full of desire to get ahead. She is a divorced woman who lives with her son in a rental house. Sophia works every day selling sodas and mangoes, increasing her clientele on the weekends which is when people consume more of these types of products. 

She is requesting a loan from Yehu to be able to buy more mangoes and sodas and thus increase her sales volume, which is essential for her. Sophia has been in this business for three years now.

loans.use: to buy more mangoes and sodas

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi  is a fishmonger at Asafora near Cape Coast. She buys fresh fish from the market and smokes it for sale. This she has done for 8 years.  She is married to a fisherman and has six children. She uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their family.  Esi will use her loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase  more fresh fish to smoke for sale.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba  is a fishmonger at Asafora near Cape Coast. She buys fresh fish from the market and fries it for sale. This she has done for 10 years.  She is married to a farmer and has two children. She uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their family.  Aba  will use her loan to purchase more fresh fish to fry  for sale. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish to fry  for sale.

loans.name: Klara

texts.en: Klara runs a cosmetics sales business from a little space at the Univermag store in Vinogradov, Ukraine. In business for about five years, she sells about 14,000 UAH worth of products and makes around 2,000 - 3,000 UAH per month. She has been able to secure a very good location for her business and tries to maintain a broad assortment of quality cosmetic and personal care items to sell. She has requested a loan of 15,000 UAH to increase her working capital and allow her to purchase additional inventory.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of her cosmetics business

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru:
Мавчуда портниха. Она занимается шитьем платьев у себя дома. Также Мавчуда шьет матрасы (курпача) на заказ. В этой области она девять лет. Ей 34 года. Она замужем. 
Мавчуда просит кредит для приобретения ниток, тканей, ваты, материалов и рабочего стола.
texts.en: Mavjuda is a seamstress.  She is involved in sewing dresses at home.  Mavjuda also sews mattresses (kurpacha) to-order.  She has been in this business for nine years.  She is 34 years old and married.  Mavjuda is requesting this loan to purchase threads, fabrics, cotton filling, materials and a work desk.

loans.use: to purchase threads, fabrics, cotton filling, materials and a work desk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fancy clothes, ornaments, bags, shoes etc.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is a petty trader. She sells panties, underwear,  ladies' wear  and children's dresses in Asafora near Cape Coast. She has been in this business for the past eight years now. Esi is single. She uses her income to pay her utility and accommodation bills.  She needs this loan to enable her purchase more underwear and ladies's and children's dresses to sell. With the new profit, she plans to acquire a shop for the sale of her dresses.

loans.use: purchase more underwear and ladies' and children's dresses to sell.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma is a 55-year-old married woman from Albur, Bohol. She has seven children; the oldest child is thirty-four while the youngest is seventeen years old. She has been in the sari-sari (variety) store business for three years. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase additional merchandise like canned goods, soap, toiletries, coffee and sugar. In the future, Wilma would like to expand  her business to invest in other ventures and at the same time to provide quality education to her children.

loans.use: to buy additional canned goods, soap, toiletries, and coffee

loans.name: Shoista

texts.ru: Прекрасная женщина из Таджикистана нуждается вашей поддержки. Ее зовут Шоиста и ей 20 лет. Она замужем на прекрасного человека, которого зовут Наимджон, но не имеет  детей. Доход ее мужа не достаточно для оплаты обучения Шоисты в колледже, так как она является студенткой 3 курса Педагогического колледжа. Она должна оплатить годовой договор и поэтому она запрашивает займ для оплаты обучения в колледже. Она ждет и надеется на вашу доброту.
texts.en: A beautiful woman from Tajikistan needs your support.  Her name is Shoista and she is 20 years old.  She is married to a beautiful person, whose name is Naimdjon, but does not have children.  Her husband's income is not enough to pay for Shoista's college education.  She is a third-year student of a Pedagogical college.  She has to pay for her annual contract and is requesting this loan to pay for her college education.  Shoista awaits and hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her college education

loans.name: Primo

texts.en:
Primo is 37 years old and married, living in Migpange, Bonifacio. To add income in the family, he entered into a buy and sell business that started 20 years ago. He usually gets PHP 15,000 per month. 

With the help of GDMPC microcredit, Primo was able to obtain more items to sell such as soaps, sugar, milk and etc because of the PHP 12,000 rendered to him. He joined GDMPC this year. 

Someday, he hopes for much greater revenue for business expansion.

loans.use: to obtain more items to sell such as soaps, sugar, milk and etc

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly, a 41-year-old married mother of two children, lives in Liposong, Ozamis City. To earn a living, Shirly is making and selling charcoal which is made from coconut shell. She has been doing this for 16 years and earns 25000 PHP a month. 

Shirly joined the GDMPC family in 2008. She has asked for a loan of 25000 PHP to pay for the labor cost in charcoal making. In the future, Shirly hopes to acquire more resources to sustain her business operations and to sell her product for a higher price to other buyers, if possible.

loans.use: to pay for the labor cost in charcoal making.

loans.name: Maa Durga Group

texts.en:
Indu, an active married lady of 32, is a resident of Bolangir town of Bolangir district of Odisha, India. The lady standing in the middle of the front row with raised hand is Indu. Her father-in-law migrated to Bolangir 25 years ago in search of work and since then her family is residing in a slum area of the town. In her family she has her husband, one son aged 14, and three daughters aged 10, 5 and 2 years. She hails from a below-poverty-line category. 

To increase the income of her family, in the year 2010 she involved herself along with other four women of the same category of her locality and formed a joint liability group named Maa Durga to access loans from Mahashakti Foundation.

For 15 years Indu, with the help of her husband, has been running two mobile businesses units with push carts. The first one is  selling  a mixture of puffed rice and boiled gram locally known as “'mudhi' mixture”  and second one  is mobile vending of low cost fancy items like balls, cups, plates, glasses, plastic containers, toys etc. in different localities, moving here and there. Her husband runs the 1st business from 1.00 pm to 5.00 pm in front of a school area and from 6.00 pm to 9.30 pm in the market area. 

The timing of the 2nd business is from 8.00 am to 12.00 noon. The role of Indu in running the businesses is to prepare puffed rice, boil gram, pack related items and make the push cart ready to go for selling. For this she has to work for 15-18 hours daily. Apart from this she has another two push carts which she has given on rent to other persons. 

Indu gets a monthly income of Rs.3000-4000 INR from these businesses and it is very hard to manage the household, educational, medical and business expenses.

Due to financial constraints she could not store more items and has to face losses due to frequent purchase of items at retail cost. So she wants to use the present loan for purchasing of more stock of   gram, rice for preparation of puffed rice, mixture, oil, plastic toys and containers at a wholesale rate to avoid financial losses due to fluctuation of material costs from time to time. She has also a plan to start another two business of chart (mixture of boiled gram, vegetables and spices) and 'Gupchup' selling in other two pushcarts by employing two people.

Indu hopes to give better education to her children and dreams to construct a 'pucca' house to have better living conditions and to see her children in respectable positions in society.

The other four energetic group members are Rashmita, Anandini, Santosini and Pankajini who are doing goat rearing, a mobile repairing center, tailoring and vegetable vending businesses respectively.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing grams (lentils), rice, mixture, oil, etc.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua sells maize porridge. She serves the porridge with bread at Asafora near Cape Coast.  She is married to a farmer and has five children. Efua has been selling maize porridge for six years now.  She uses her income to support the husband to feed and clothe her children and pay their school fees.  

Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and flour to prepare her porridge and bread for sale. With the new profit, Efua will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and flour to prepare her porridge and bread for sale.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is 52 years old and lives with his family in the Tskaltubo district. He runs an agricultural business. In particular, he has 2 pigs and sells the piglets locally. In addition, Solomon owns 3 greenhouses, in which different types of greens, tomatoes and cucumbers are grown.  Solomon sells the harvested products at the local open market. He works hard to increase his savings and to improve the living conditions for his family.

Solomon requested the credit for renovation of his greenhouse. He will purchase a polyethylene cover and replace the current one. When the greenhouse is renovated, it will maintain the needed temperature, and his family will harvest more products. It will increase their income from sales. Solomon plans to use the increased income to expand his agricultural business and to improve the living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a polyethylene cover for his greenhouse.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is a 22-year-old married woman  with two children, ages two years old and seven months old.She hails from Panglao, Bohol. She has been in the hog raising business for almost one year. She earns three thousand  pesos a month by doing the hog raising business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional piglets, feed and pig supplement. In the future, Mary Jane would like to expand her business to support her family and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua  sells plastic bowls and baskets  and  saucepans  at Asafora near Cape Coast, which she has done for 14 years now. Ekua is married to an auto electrican and has five children.  She uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of their family. Ekua want to increase sales so she will use her loan to purchase more plastic bowls, baskets  and saucepans.   With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic bowls, baskets  and metal saucepans

loans.name: Rubi

texts.en: Ms Rubi is 31 years old and unmarried. She has five siblings and she is the eldest among them. The boy shown in the photo is her brother who is running a welding business for five years. Rubi is not shown in the photo because she has problem in facing camera as she is a shy person and doesn't allow to take her pictures. Her brother has great skills in this work. Rubi has taken several loans from Kashf Foundation to support her brother’s business. Her father is not in good enough physical shape to be employed. Her brother is working hard day and night to provide his family with the basic necessities of life such as food, clothing and health. Now, Rubi has requested a loan of RS 35,000/- to buy more spare parts to cater more customers consistently. Her brother hopes to earn more income to support her family well. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts to facilitate more customers consistently.

loans.name: Tasmina

texts.en:
Mrs. Tasmina is 28 years old. She has five children and she is a housewife. The man shown in the photo is Tasmina's husband. Tasmina is not shown in the photo because she is a shy person and use veil to cover her face. Her husband was unemployed and it was very hard for her to run even the kitchen of her house. She contacted Kashf Foundation to establish a business selling potatoes for her husband. Tasmina’s husband  established his potato shop one year ago with the support of a loan from Kahsf and they repaid the loan on time according to the repayment schedule.

Tasmina's husband purchases potatoes in bulk and then sells them to different shopkeepers. During the year, he has established good contacts in the market and with the high demand, he needs additional funds to fulfill these demands. Mrs. Tasmina requested a loan of Rs 20,000/- to increase her husband's business. They are hopeful that with the increased funds, they can earn enough to fulfill the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy stock of potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia a responsible mother who is engaged in selling different products in the remote area of Capellan in the province of Isabela. She is 46 years old and married to a farmer, Lorenzo. Leticia is asking for a loan of PHP 23,000 to buy additional grocery products that she can display in her store. She hopes that she will see her three school-aged children walking the stage to get their diploma.

loans.use: to buy noodles, coffee, sugar, milk and spices for her store

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en:
Adwowa is a fishmonger at Asafora near Cape Coast. She buys fresh fish from the market and smokes and fries it for sale. This she has done for eight years.  

She is married to a farmer and has four children. She uses her income to assist the husband in the general upkeep of their family.  

Adwowa will use her loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke and fry for sale. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish to smoke and fry for sale.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi extracts palm oil and palm kennel oil for sale at Asafora.  Ekua is divorced and  she has 3 children. Eso has been in this business for 8 years.  She uses her income for  the  upkeep of her children.  She will use her loan to purchase palm fruit and palm kernels for the extraction of the oil to sell.

loans.use: to purchase palm fruit and palm kernels for the extraction of the oil to sell

loans.name: Maa Bhagawati Group

texts.en:
The name of this  Joint Liability Group is Maa Bhagawati. This group was formed in the year 2009,comprising six active and able women of Bolangir town of Bolangir district  in Odisha; India. Saraswati is one of the members of this group who is standing on the extreme left with raised hand in the photo. She is a very headstrong, confident lady with noble thoughts and posseses a strong determination for the development of her family. She has also an inclination to do something for society especially for women.  She is 45 years old; living with her husband and a son of 23 years old, taking technical training in ITI. (Industrial Training Institute) 

Saraswati has been involved in tailoring work for the last 10 years. She is doing two types of work related to tailoring. She herself has a sewing machine in her residence to take orders of stitching of ladies' garments. Apart from that she is running a tailoring training center with 3 sewing machines in another location. Presently she is imparting training to 20 young girls in two shifts. The 1st shift is from 8.00 am to 10.00 am and the 2nd shift from 4.00 pm to 6.00 pm. There is also demand from candidates for training but due to lack of sufficient infrastructure she is not able to train them. 

Looking into the demand for training, Saraswati wants to purchase another 2-3 sewing machines and an interlock machine for the training center. Saraswati says, “It matters little how much money I am earning from imparting training to the trainees, but matters if   somebody builds her career for an improved livelihood in a respectable manner.” Saraswati is well known as a ladies' garments specialist in her locality.
  
The other five members of this group are Minati, Runu, Sabitri (M), Sabitri (P) and Rupa who are running a cloth business, a daily needs shop, a 'Tiffin hotel' and a rice business.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing sewing machines

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is from the village of Capellan. She is 42 years old, is married, and has six adult children. 

Flordeliza owns and operates a business preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. 

Flordeliza hopes to improve her business and living situation. She is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a very young person who is working to meet the needs of her family. She is married to Marvin, with two school aged children. 

She has been involved in raising pigs for five years. She strives well in her business so that she can send her two children to school. She hopes that her business will expand so that she can build their own house.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feeds for her business.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is a single parent and has three children. They live together at Asafora near Cape Coast. She sells locally made soft drinks made out of maize, and she also sells soap. She has done this for three years now. 

As a single parent, she uses her income to feed and clothe her children and pay their school fees. 

Esi will use her loan to purchase maize for her locally made soft drinks and boxes of soap to sell.  With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize for her locally made soft drinks and also boxes of soap to sell.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba, pictured here scooping soup from a pot, operates a food bar, where she sells a variety of African dishes. The types of food she serves are fufu, banku and rice balls. She has been in this line of business for four years.

She is married, and her husband works as a driver. She and her husband have four children. Araba uses her income to help pay for their children’s school fees.

She is seeking this loan to purchase food ingredients so that she can prepare various foods for sale. With the profits she expects to generate as a result of the loan, Araba plans to get a different place so that she can better serve her customers.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional food ingredients

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel de 40 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con sus 3 hijos en las edades de 9 a 20 años, a quienes sueña ver convertidos en personas exitosas. Ella trabaja esmeradamente  preparando almuerzos, para obtener ingresos con los cuales lograr el bienestar de su familia, desde hace 15 años cuando inició su negocio, basada  en la experiencia que adquirió de su familia, quienes se dedicaban a este tipo de actividad. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y algunas veces a crédito, en un trabajo que inicia desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde, mientras sus compras las hace de contado en el mercado de la ciudad, donde frecuentemente encuentra ofertas, por comprar en mayor volumen. Los principales clientes de sus  almuerzos son los conductores de buses urbanos  y tractomulas; hoy su clientela está en creciente aumento y su capital de trabajo no es suficiente, para lograr responder a su clientela como ella lo requiere, para continuar fidelizandolos. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materia prima en mayor volumen, sillas, mesas, y menaje de cocina, todo ello con el fin de lograr un proceso productivo efectivo, un servicio donde la clientela se sienta muy confortable y regresen a comprarle, porque para  Maribel todo esto es  ganancia.
texts.en:
Maribel, 40, lives in the city of Cartagena with her three children, ages 9 to 20, whom she dreams of becoming successful.  She works conscientiously preparing lunch to earn income to achieve her family's well-being.

She began her business 15 years ago based on experience she got from her family, who made a living in this type of work.  She makes her sales in cash and sometimes on credit, working from 6 in the morning until 3 in the afternoon.   She makes her purchases in cash in the city market, where she frequently finds sales for buying in bulk.  Her main customers are the drivers of city buses and tractor trailers.

Her clientele is increasing now and she doesn't have sufficient working capital to be able to respond to her customers as she would like, to continue cultivating their loyalty.  This is why she's asking for a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she'll buy raw materials wholesale, chairs, tables, and kitchen items.  

Her goal is to achieve an effective and productive process for providing a service with which the customers feel comfortable and return to buy from her, because for Maribel, all of this is profits.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, chairs, tables, and kitchen items

loans.name: Penniah's Group

texts.en:
Penniah's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Penniah is 23 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past four years, Penniah has been working hard to manage her raw foods stall, which sells matooke and cassava.

To help expand her business, Penniah has requested a loan in the amount of of 800,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan proceeds will be used to buy more matooke, cassava and sweet potatoes, and will help Penniah to generate additional profits and to pay for her children's school fees. In the future, Penniah hopes to be able to expand her business and to improve her family's standard of living.

Penniah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional food items (e.g., matooke, cassava and sweet potatoes)

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 43-year-old, married woman. She is blessed with six children, all of whom she supports.

For the last five years, she has been farming to earn a living; specifically, she grows French beans for sale in the Narok area. Her monthly income is approximately 80,000 KES. She is requesting a third loan from KADET, this time in the amount of 70,000 KES, which would be used to pay for her crop harvest and the transportation of her harvest to various markets.

The profits she expects to generate as a result of the loan will be used to support her business. In the future she dreams of operating a stable, large-scale farming business.

loans.use: to expand her business by harvesting and transporting her crops to the market

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 22 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, one of whom currently attends school. For the past three years, Christine has been working hard to manage her salon, where she sells hair pieces and styles hair. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hair pieces and hair styling products, and will help Christine to generate greater profits and help her maintain her family. Christine hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more hair pieces and hair styling products

loans.name: Conceptor

texts.en:
Conceptor is a 29-year-old farmer living in Nyamira County, Kenya. She lives with her husband and their four children, three of whom are in school.

For four years, she has been harvesting and producing potatoes, milk, tea, coffee, and tomatoes. She then sells all of her produce and dairy products to local customers. In fact, she owns and operates a small retail shop, which serves as an additional source of income. Even so, Concepter states that a lack of capital for her farming operations is her major business challenge.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. The cow would help her to produce more milk and to thereby generate more income, which would help her to pay for her children’s school fees and to improve her family's living standards. She also intends to expand her tea plantation to two hectares in the near future.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing a dairy cow

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en: Arsenia is a 55-year-old married woman from San Isidro District, Tagbilaran City, Bohol. She has been in the sari-sari (variety) store business for three years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional groceries to sell including soft drinks, rice, canned goods and bottled mineral water, as well as shampoo and toiletries. Arsenia would like to expand her business to support her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as soft drinks and dry goods

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is a 53-year-old farmer living in Nyamira County, Kenya. She lives with her husband and their five children, one of whom attends school.

For the past 23 years, she has been in the farming and agriculture business. Through her operations she harvests and produces eggs, milk, vegetables and tea. She then sells her produce and dairy products to local customers. In fact, she operates a food store as an additional source of income. She explains that her major business challenge is the susceptibility of her chickens to diseases and death.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase materials to construct a poultry unit using 30,000 KES of the proceeds, to purchase poultry using 20,000 KES of the proceeds, and to pay for poultry feed using 10,000 KES of the proceeds. She expects that the loan will allow her to generate an increase in her typical income, which would help her to pay for her children’s college fees. In the future, she aspires to be a major egg supplier in her area. Peris is so happy with the help she has received from Juhudi Kilimo and hopes to continue to improve her family's living standards in the future.

loans.use: To purchase materials (for constructing a poultry unit), poultry, and poultry feed

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is a 63-year-old farmer in Litein County in Kenya where he lives with his wife and seven children. Four of his children are in school. He has been in farming for thirty years producing tea, milk and coffee which he sells in the local market.

He is requesting a 50,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase milk pans that will help him in supplying milk more easily to his clients. In a few years, he hopes to build a modern dairy unit.

Pests and diseases are his major challenges in farming.

Ezekiel is very grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for lending to him.

loans.use: To purchase milk pans

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana, de 59 años, es una mujer trabajadora y valiente, es madre soltera de siete hijos que ya son mayores y a quienes dio educación esforzándose mucho por salir adelante.Ella tiene su casa propia en donde vive junto a una hija y su nieto que tiene 1 año de edad, juntas trabajan para poder mejorar su situación económica y brindarle al niño una buena calidad de vida. El trabajo de Ana, consiste en la venta de abarrotes al por menor, ella se encarga de comprar al por mayor en la tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad y de ahí los vende en su tienda al menudeo. Su negocio esta ubicado en su casa en una calle muy concurrida de la ciudad y es por eso que es muy visitada, tiene una gran variedad de productos como plátanos, huevos, harina, fideos, gaseosas, panes entre otros, ya que sus clientes son muy exigentes.Lleva en este negocio más de 15 años y lo complementa con la venta de prendas de vestir usadas y ocasionalmente vende comida. Trabaja con la ayuda de su hija quien se encarga de la atención cuando ella no puede estar en casa.

Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que dispone de su tiempo para poder realizar las labores de su hogar y poder cuidar a su nieta, como tienen muchas ventas genera muchas ganancias y espera poder agrandar su negocio mas adelante. Este es el crédito número 5 con MFP, por tanto agradece a todos los que hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, ella por su parte se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son personas muy amables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará mercadería principalmente arroz, huevo y plátano,  para su bodega.
texts.en:
Ana, 59, is a hardworking and brave woman.  She's the single mother of seven adult children whom she gave an education by making the effort to get ahead.  She has her own house where she lives with one daughter and her grandchild, age 1.  Together they work to improve their financial situation and give the child a good quality of life.

Ana's job is selling groceries retail.  She buys in bulk in the wholesale markets in the city and then sells them retail in her store.  Her business is located in her house on a very busy city street, so she gets a lot of customers.  She has a wide variety of products like bananas, eggs, flour, pasta, soda, bread, and other things, because her customers are very demanding.  She has had the business for more than 15 years and she supplements it by selling used clothing; she also occasionally sells food.  She works with the help of her daughter who is responsible for waiting on customers when Ana can't be at home.

What she likes about her job is that she has time to be able to do the housework and take care of her granddaughter.  She earns a lot of profit because she has a lot of sales, and she hopes to expand her business in the future.

This is her fifth loan with MFP and she's grateful to those who make her loan possible so she can continue with her goals.  She pledges to make her payments punctually.  She's very happy to belong to her communal bank because all the members are very kind and supportive people.

With the requested amount of 1000 soles [PEN] she'll buy merchandise, mainly rice, eggs, and bananas for her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy rice, eggs, and bananas

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 61-year-old farmer in Nyamira County in Kenya, where she lives with her husband and seven children, one of whom is still attending school. She has been in farming for the past twenty years, producing milk, sorghum, maize, beans, and wheat, which she sells locally.

She is requesting a 60,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow, which will increase her income so that she does not have to work too hard as she gets older.

Being in her old age, which makes her have less energy to work as hard as she used to, is her major challenge.

Jane is so grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for lending her the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en:
Hillary is aged twenty-two and a farmer in Litein County in Kenya, where he has been in farming for three years. He is doing mixed farming, producing tea and milk which he sells to the local market. He also does a boda-boda (a motorcycle equipped for transport) service business, which he uses to buy and sell tea, as an additional source of income.

He is requesting a 40,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo. He will use the loan for buying materials for constructing a dairy unit for his dairy cows in order to increase production and thus have more income. That will help him improve in the provision of his family's basic needs.

High competition and lack of readily available markets are some of his challenges in farming.

Hillary thanks Juhudi Kilimo for lending him the loan.

loans.use: to purchase materials for constructing a dairy unit.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 36 years old and a farmer from Nyamira County in Kenya, where she lives with her husband and six children.  Four are still in school.

She has been in farming for the past eight years, producing milk, sorghum, and vegetables that she sells to the people around his local area. She also sells second-hand clothes as an additional source of income.

She is requesting a loan of KES 60,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to buy materials for building a dairy unit.  That will improve her milk production and create more income, which will help her in giving her children valuable education.

Poor markets due to monotony in products are her major challenge.

Teresa wishes to get more products from Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: To purchase materials for constructing a dairy unit.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 39-year-old businessman in Mombasa. He operates a garage, a business he ventured into eight years ago. He is married to Jackline, with whom he is blessed with one daughter, four years old.

This is his first business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase spanners, bolts, and car wheels. 

He will use the anticipated profits to improve the living standards of his family. He hopes to become a prominent businessman.

loans.use: to purchase spanners, bolts, and car wheels.

loans.name: Johnstone

texts.en:
Johnstone is aged forty-three and a farmer in Litein County in Kenya. He lives with his wife and four children, three of whom are schooling. He has been in farming for the past twenty years, producing tea and milk, which he sells to the people around his local area.

He is requesting a 65,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase materials for constructing a dairy unit for his dairy cows. This will help in increasing his milk production; hence more income, better living standards, and the ability to pay school fees for his children. He aspires to acquire three more quality dairy cows in the near future.

Unreliable artificial insemination for dairy cows is his major problem.

He requests Juhudi Kilimo to give them more support in terms of dairy farming training.

loans.use: to purchase materials for constructing a dairy unit.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 18 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past four years, Susan has been working hard to manage her salon, where she sells cosmetics and hair pieces. 

To help expand her business, Susan has requested a loan of UGX 600,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cosmetics and products for hair.  It will help Susan to generate greater profits and maintain and nurture her family. Susan hopes she will be able to have a better future. 

Susan is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics and products for hair.

loans.name: Joweria's Group

texts.en:
Joweria's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Joweria is 21 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, with two of them currently in school. 

For the past two years, Joweria has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells chicken. 

To help expand her business, Joweria has requested a loan of UGX 600,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more poultry feed.  It will help Joweria to generate greater profits and use the profits to pay school fees for her children. 

Joweria hopes that in the future she will be able to to buy a plot of land. 

Joweria is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more poultry feed.

loans.name: Gloria Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: La socia Gloria nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 49 años de edad y es soltera pero tiene dos hijos. La socia Gloria es empleada y trabaja en una entidad del estado, ella en sus horas libres se dedica a la elaboración de collares, pulseras, aretes y otras joyas más. Ya son varios años que se que se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía y le va muy bien. Ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo hilos, alambres y otras cosas más. La socia Gloria pertenece al banco comunal “Los Andes” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en: Gloria was born in the city of Cusco and still lives in the city of her birth.  She’s 49-years-old, single but has two children.  Gloria is employed working for a state entity and in her free time makes necklaces, earrings and other jewelry.  She’s been making crafts for several years now and does very well.  On this occasion she needs the loan to buy supplies like thread, wired and other things.  Gloria’s a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Los Andes” communal bank in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy supplies like thread, wire and other things.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es:
Dora, administra un negocio de pupusas, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, ella está realizando las ventas diariamente como una fuente de ingresos para su familia.

Actualmente Dora necesita realizar la inversión en productos para la elaboración de la venta por ejemplo aceite, condimentos, quesillo, chicharrón, que esto le permitirá tener más productos a la mano para poder aumentar la elaboración de las pupusas, y así también sus ingresos.

Ella quiere con el préstamo poder realizar una buena inversión que le dé una mejor solvencia y capacidad al negocio para atender a la clientela.
texts.en: Dora runs a pupusa [filled, grilled corncake] business.  She lives with her husband and two children.  She sells daily as a source of family income.  Currently, Dora needs to buy ingredients like oil, condiments, string cheese and pork to make the things she sells.  This will allow her to have more ingredients on hand to increase pupusa production as well as her income.  She wants to use the loan to make a good investment that will lead to improved solvency and capacity for the business to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy oil, condiments, string cheese and pork.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 50 years old and a farmer in Nyamira County in Kenya, where she lives with her husband and seven children.  One is still schooling. 

She has been in farming for the past 20 years, producing milk, coffee, wheat,and sorghum that she sells locally.  She also runs a cereal store as an additional source of income.

She is requesting a loan of KES 60,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to buy materials for constructing a dairy unit for her dairy cows to help in improving her milk production, as well as her living standards.  She plans to be a prominent cereal wholesaler in future.

Contagious animal diseases are her major challenge in dairy farming.

Joyce says she is proud to be part of Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: To purchase materials to construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Inés es separada y tiene dos hijos  los cuales  están en etapa escolar , viven en casa de su ex esposo, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Bautista Saavedra de la ciudad de El Alto.
Inés estudio solo hasta el nivel primario y actualmente se dedica a la venta de sombreros en la feria de Rio Seco los días martes y viernes; también vende los días jueves y domingo en la zona 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto.
El crédito lo requiere para adquirir sombreros de distintos colores y texturas ya que son exigencias de su clientela y ella no puede perder esas ventas pues son único medio de ingresos.
El sueño de Inés  es convertirse en micro empresaria y tener una tienda de sombreros y ser proveedora al por mayor.
Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Inés is separated and has two school-age children.  They live in her ex-husband’s house located in the city of El Alto’s Bautista Saavedra zone.  Inés only attended elementary school and currently is a hat seller at the Río Seco street market Tuesdays and Fridays.  She also sells on Thursdays and Sundays in the city of El Alto’s 16 de Julio zone.

She needs the loan to buy hats in assorted colors and textures because this is what her customers are requesting and she must not lose these sales since they are her only source of income.

Inés’ dream is to become a micro businesswoman and to have a hat shop where she can sell at wholesale.  This is her third Impro loan request and first with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy hats in assorted colors and textures.

loans.name: Gs Jerusalen Group

texts.es:
La señora María tiene 37 años, vive en la zona sur de Honduras, junto con el vive sus 2 hijos y su esposo quien la respalda en cada uno de sus compromisos, su negocio es la venta de tortillas actividad que realiza desde hace 7 años en su casa de habitación. Su negocio se encuentra en un punto de fácil accesos para cada uno de sus clientes ya que esta en la calle principal de la colonia donde vive, y esto se presta para que tenga mucha demanda.
Doña María el crédito lo necesita para compra de: cal, maíz, leña y un sartén. El impacto esperado con el crédito, es satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, ya que comprara bastante producto para contrarrestar la demanda de cada uno de sus clientes los cuales visitan su casa desde muy temprano de la mañana.
Los planes a futuro de Doña María es seguir creciendo en su actividad, y de esta manera darles una mejor educación a sus hijos y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Santos se dedica a la venta de mercadería variada.
María Cristina se dedica a la venta de tortillas y la venta de plásticos.
Choluteca Honduras, - Septiembre del 2012
texts.en:
María, 37, lives in south Honduras with her two children and her husband who backs her up in all of her commitments.  Her business is selling tortillas, an activity she started 7 years ago at home.  Her business has a location that’s easily accessible for each one of her customers since it’s on her neighborhood’s main street and this leads to high demand.

María needs the loan to buy lime powder, corn, firewood and a pan.  The impact she expects from the loan is to meet customer demand since she will buy enough product to respond to demand from all of her customers who start coming by starting very early in the morning.

Her future plan is to continue growing in her activity so that she can provide her children with a better education and in order to have a better quality of life.  

Santos sells varied merchandise and María Cristina sells tortillas and plastic ware.

Choluteca, Honduras - September, 2012

loans.use: to buy lime powder, corn, firewood and a pan.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
La señora Blanca es Ejecutiva de Marketing; su nivel de educación es secundario, tiene dos hijos vive en alquiler ocupa tres habitaciones en un acabado fino y piso de machimbre en la zona de Miraflores de la ciudad de la Paz.
Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de electrodomésticos, pero ahora ha cambiado de rubro y ha conseguido un trabajo más estable.

Blanca, trabaja en una empresa privada más de ocho horas al día, para cubrir los gastos de agua, luz, el pago de alquiler ya que es la única que cubre todos los gastos de su familia.

El crédito lo requiere para el pago de  un tratamiento post Operativo a causa de una operación por tener quiste en los ovarios.

El sueño de Blanca es vivir en casa propia ya que actualmente vive en alquiler, también mejorar más la calidad de vida de sus hijos y de ella.

Es la segunda vez con IMPRO y la segunda con Kiva.
texts.en:
Blanca is a marketing executive; she completed secondary school.  She has two children and is a renter.  She occupies three bedrooms with finished walls and hardwood floors in the city of La Paz’s Miraflores zone.

She used to sell home appliances but she’s now changed her line of work and has more stable employment.  Blanca works more than 8 hours daily for a private firm in order to cover water, electricity and rent costs because all family expenses are her responsibility.

She needs the loan to pay for post-surgery treatment due to an operation she had for ovarian cysts.  Blanca’s dream is to live in a house of her own because she currently is a renter and also to improve her and her children’s quality of life more.  This is her second Impro loan request and second with Kiva too.

loans.use: to pay for post-surgery treatment.

loans.name: Dennys

texts.es:
Dennys, es soltero y no tiene  hijos, vive en casa de sus padres, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Zona franca Industrial de la ciudad de El Alto.
Dennys se encuentra estudiando la carrera de gastronomía en un instituto y se graduara a nivel técnico medio.
El crédito lo requiere para la cancelación de sus mensualidades al Instituto, para así poder ser habilitado para rendir exámenes finales.
El sueño de Dennys es poder culminar sus estudios y tener su propio restaurant.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Dennys is single and has no children.  He lives in his parents’ house located in the city of El Alto’s Franca Industrial zone.  Dennys is studying gastronomy at an institute and will graduate as a mid-level technician.  He needs the loan to pay his monthly tuition at the institute in order to be able to take final exams.  His dream is to complete his studies and have his own restaurant.  This is the first time he’s requested an Impro and Kiva loan.

loans.use: to pay monthly tuition.

loans.name: Iris Esmeralda

texts.es:
Iris, se dedica a la venta de mariscos, está acompañada con su esposo y tiene dos hijos, ella comenzó este negocio por la necesidad de poder tener un ingreso más para el sustento de su familia, realiza su trabajo desde las ocho de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde.

Actualmente necesita poder invertir en el negocio comprandose marisco fresco para aumentar la demanda en los clientes como por ejemplo comprará pescado, langostas, conchas, filete, y otra variedad que existe esto le permitirá tener una mejor solvencia para atender las demandas de los clientes.

Con el negocio y espera tener un buen efecto de la inversión de este préstamo, que le permita aumentar sus ganancias y poder a futuro ir mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Iris sells seafood for a living. She is accompanied by her husband and has two children. She started this business because her family needed an extra income. She works from 8:00 o'clock in the morning until 5:00 o'clock in the afternoon.

She currently needs to invest in her business, purchasing fresh seafood to meet customer demand. She will purchase fish, lobster, clams, filets, and a variety of other seafood, which will help her business be financially solvent and meet customer demand.

She expects good returns from this loan, an investment that will allow her to increase her earnings and improve her family's quality of life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish, lobster, clams, filets, and a variety of other seafood.

loans.name: Karen Jeniffer

texts.es: Karen tiene 22 años estado civil soltera, tiene 1 hijo. Karen comenta que a causa de la falta de empleo que posee el país y no podía encontrar un trabajo fijo, tomo  el rumbo de ser una comerciante. Pero uno de sus mayores impedimentos es la  falta de capital, pues lo que  ella vende  es  ropa. Con el préstamo Karen va a comprar: abrigos, blusas, pantalones, camisetas etc.
texts.en: Karen, 22, is single and has a son.  Karen comments that because of the lack of employment opportunities in the country she was unable to find a steady job so she decided to become a merchant.  One of her greatest impediments, however, is lack of capital because what she sells is clothes.  Karen will use the loan to buy coats, blouses, pants, T-shirts, etc.

loans.use: to buy coats, blouses, pants, T-shirts, etc.

loans.name: Virgen Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN GUADALUPE”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Margot ella es conviviente y tiene 28 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes,ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,leche,galletas y dulces,la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,la socia tiene 4 meses en este negocio y antes de dedicaba al negocio de venta de refrescos en la ciudad de Quillabamba que queda a 6 horas de la ciudad del Cusco pero no le fue muy bien porque ganaba muy poco dinero,el sueño de la socia es ampliar y tener un tienda de abarrotes mas grande. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite galletas. 
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de crianza de animales y negocio de venta de maiz.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members of the “Virgen Guadalupana” communal bank are located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.  Margot, 28, has a spouse and two children.  

She works in her grocery store selling basic staples like rice, sugar, milk, cookies and candy.  She works from 6am until 10pm and has been in business four months.  She used to work selling soft-drinks in the city of Quillabamba that’s six hours from the city of Cusco but she didn’t do too well because profits were very low.  

Her dream is to expand and have a bigger grocery store.  She requests the loan to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, milk, oil and cookies for the store.  She is grateful to those who share her dream by this means and commits to make her installment payments as scheduled.

The other members sell food, vegetables, corn and raise animals.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, oil and cookies.

loans.name: Ntapote

texts.en:
Ntapote is 42 years old, married to Nanyikae, and blessed with four children that he supports. He is a wheat and maize farmer in Narok town and has been in farming for the last four years. He earns an income of KES. 45,000 monthly. 

He is servicing his fourth loan of KES. 90,000 from KADET LTD. The loan will facilitate in land preparation and purchase of farm inputs to help him get better yields.

He intends to use the anticipated profits to support his business and provide for basic family needs. His future dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and prepare the land.

loans.name: Nuestra Señora De Guadalupe Group

texts.es: El banco comunal nuestra señora de Guadalupe, esta conformado por 10 integrantes, madres solteras con  15 hijos  bajo su responsabilidad. Ellas pertenecen al municipio de Sauce lugar que esta ubicado en la zona norte del país. Son mujeres que se caracterizan por ser luchadoras, trabajadoras, mujeres humilde del campo. Todas tienen actividades económicas diferentes propias de la región. Como venta de cuajadas, venta de comidas, crianza de cerdos. Rosa Argentina es la coordinadora del banco comunal la cual se encarga de la responsabilidad del  banco en cuanto al cumplimiento de las cuotas  de pagos en tiempo y forma. Rosa Argentina tiene por actividad económica la venta de cuajada y leche ubicada en su casa de habitación. Rosa su rutina diaria es levantarse a la 4 de la mañana para elaborar las cuajadas  y ofrecerlas a sus clientela en horas tempranas. El objetivo del crédito e invertir en capital de trabaja para comprar mas leche y producir mas cuajada la cual es su actividad principal. El banco comunal Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua.
texts.en:
The “Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe” (Our Lady of Guadalupe) communal bank has ten members, all single mothers with fifteen children in their care.  They are from the city of Sucre located in the northern part of the country.  They are women noted for being very tenacious, hardworking, humble,  country women.  They all have different economic activities typical of the region like the sale of milk curd, food and raising pigs.

Rosa Argentina is the communal bank coordinator so she’s responsible for insuring that the communal bank members make their installment payments properly and as scheduled.  Her economic activity is selling milk curd and milk from home.  Rosa’s daily routine starts when she rises at 4am to make the curd to sell to her customers early in the morning.  The goal of the loan is to invest in working capital to buy more milk and produce more curd which is her main activity.  

The Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe communal bank is grateful for the support Kiva lenders provide people of limited resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy more milk.

loans.name: Norma Marina

texts.es: Norma se dedica a la confección de ropa familiar, negocio que inició desde el año 1993, elaborando ropa interior, pues en su época de juventud era ese el oficio al que se de dedicaban muchas mujeres, cuando no contaban con estudios superiores a la primaria. Poco a poco fue con esta actividad, generando ingresos para apoyar el bienestar de su familia, conformada por sus tres hijos, hoy en las edades de 21 a 30 años y mucho después empezó a especializarse en ropa deportiva y gradualmente aprendió a trabajar la línea de uniformes y últimamente la línea familiar en su propio taller, donde gana dinero y apoya el bienestar de sus hijos con este negocio. Su meta es tener el taller bien dotado, con una infraestructura productiva completa, esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará una maquina de coser, una fileteadora, y un mueble para mejorar su equipamiento y generar mejoras en los tiempos productivos y así mismo las diversas tareas de la confección.
texts.en: Norma makes family clothing for a living. She started this business in 1993, at first making undergarments because when she was young, many women did that for a living when they did not have more than an elementary school education. Her business grew little by little, and she has been generating an income to support the well-being of her family, which is comprised of three children from the ages of 21 through 30. She later started specializing in making sports apparel, and she gradually learned how to make uniforms. Lately, she has been making clothes for the whole family in her own workshop, where she makes money to help her children. Her goal is to have a well-equipped workshop with a complete production line, which is exactly why she is now requesting a Kiva loan, her first from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to purchase a sewing machine, an overlock machine, and a cabinet. Thus, she will improve her equipment and be more productive and diverse with her work.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine, an overlock machine, and a cabinet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy foam, leather and accessories.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is a fish monger in Asafora, near Cape Coast. She buys fresh fish from the market and smokes it for resale. She has done this for 10 years.

Abena is married to a fisherman and has five children. She uses her income to assist the husband in the general up keep of their family.  Abena will use her loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for resale.

loans.name: Ulises Francisco

texts.es:
Ulises, tiene 38 años de edad,esta casado, tiene dos hijos, viven en casa familiar, él trabaja en un taller de electricidad industrial, este oficio lo aprendió para obtener los ingresos necesarios, tiene tres años en el negocio, surgió por iniciativa propia.

Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprarse piezas de motor, para reparar el compresor con el que trabaja, esto le ayudara para mejorar las herramientas con las que realiza sus actividades, así prestara un mejor servicio.

Su objetivo es mejorar el servicio a los clientes, manteniendo en buen estado las herramientas, también quiere mejorar la condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ulises is 38 years old. He is married and has two children who live with him in the family home. He runs an industrial electrical workshop. 

Ulises first learnt the trade in order to earn the necessary income. He began on his own initiative and now his business has been up and running for three years. 

Ulises is requesting a loan to buy engine parts to repair the compressor which he uses for his work. It will help him improve the tools he uses to carry out tasks in his workshop so he can provide a better service. 

He aims to improve customer service by maintaining his tools in good working order. He also wants improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy compressor engine parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy natural and artificial flowers and materials used in floral arrangements.

loans.name: Anarela

texts.es:
La señora Anarela, vive en la zona sur de Honduras, junto con ella vive su hijo y su esposo quien también es comerciante y la apoya en el crecimiento de su actividad comercial. Su negocio se encuentra en un punto estratégico, donde la fluidez es en grandes cantidades ya que este en el centro de la ciudad y esto hace que sea muy visitado.
Doña Anarela el crédito lo necesita para la compra de: pan, dulces variados, espumillas, churros, refrescos, galletas etc. el impacto esperado con el financiamiento, es que sus ventas se incremente, ya que comprara variedad de producto para así de esta manera satisfacer las necesidades de cada uno de sus clientes.
Los planes a futuro de Doña Anarela es seguir creciendo en su actividad, y generarse mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad, al mismo tiempo darle una mejor educación a su hijo.
Choluteca Honduras - Septiembre del 2012
texts.en:
Anarela lives in the south part of Honduras with her son and husband who is also a merchant and supports her in her commercial activity.  Her business is located in a strategic spot where traffic is heavy because it’s in the center of the city; this makes it highly visited.

Anarela needs the loan to buy bread, assorted candy, meringues, snacks, soft-drinks, cookies, etc.  The impact she expects with the financing is that sales will increase because she will buy a variety of products to meet all her customers’ needs.

Her future plans are to continue growing in business and generating higher income to have better quality while at the same time providing a better education for her son.

Choluteca, Honduras - September, 2012

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Lydia's Group

texts.en:
Lydia's group is comprised of three hard-working women. Lydia is 22 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, with one currently in school. 

For the past two years, Lydia has been working hard to manage her raw food stall, where she sells matooke (steamed green banana) and cassava. 

To help expand her business, Lydia has requested a loan of UGX 300,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more matooke.  It will help Lydia generate greater profits and help her provide for the needs of her children. Lydia hopes that in the future, she will be able to build a house. 

Lydia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more matooke

loans.name: Wendy Carolina

texts.es:
Wendy, vive con su esposo y una hija, ella administra un negocio en la venta de lociones y productos de belleza este negocio surgió como una alternativa para apoyar a su esposo en las necesidades del hogar y asimismo poder recibir ingresos para cubrir otros gastos.

Ella solicita un préstamo para poder realizar la compra de lociones de diferentes fragancias, también cremas, labiales y otros productos de belleza que son utilizados por los clientes, el préstamo ayudará a mejorar su inventario y a poder aumentar las ventas.

Espera poder a través de su trabajo ir mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia y también contribuir a mejoras en sus clientes.
texts.en:
Wendy lives with her husband and daughter. She runs a beauty product and lotion business as a way to help her husband cover the household expenses, as well as to generate income to be able to cover other expenses.

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to purchase different types of lotions, fragrances, facial creams, lipsticks, and other beauty products that her customers use. This loan will help her improve her inventory and boost sales.

She hopes that through this business, she will be able to improve her family's quality of life little by little, and that she will help improve her clientele's appearance.

loans.use: to purchase different types of lotions, fragrances, facial creams, lipsticks, and other beauty products.

loans.name: Karin Yanet

texts.es: La socia Karin nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 39 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos. La socia Karin se dedica a brindar servicio de internet, ella venta de computadoras y impresoras, insumos y accesorios de computadoras. Ya son varios años que se que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar una vitrina. La socia Karin pertenece al banco comunal “Los Andes” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Karin was born in the city of Cusco and still lives there. She is 39 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children. Karin provides Internet services, but she also sells computers, printers, accessories, and computer supplies. She has been in business for several years and has done very well.

Karin is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy a display cabinet. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Andes”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to purchase a display cabinet.

loans.name: Gs El Carrizo 3 Group

texts.es:
El señor Adrián es una persona muy luchadora, dedicada a su negocio propio lo que es compra y venta de novillos, actividad que realiza desde hace 11 años en su comunidad donde vive. Su negocio se lo brinda a personas que vienen de diferentes lugares aledaños al suyo ya que por la calidad de sus productos tiene mucha demanda todas las semanas.
Don Adrián el crédito lo necesita para la compra de ganado, para así dar variedad a cada uno de sus clientes. el impacto que obtuvo con el financiamiento, es que sus ventas crecieron en gran manera , ya compro bastante producto, para satisfacer la demanda de cada uno de sus clientes.
Los planes a futuro de Don Adrián es seguir creciendo día a día en su negocio propio, para tener buenos ingresos para darle una buena educación a sus hijos, como también una mejor calidad de vida para el y su familia.

Oscar se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos.
Saydy se dedica a la elaboración  y venta de queso.

Choluteca, Honduras - Septiembre del 2012
texts.en:
Adrián’s a very tenacious man who is dedicated to his business which is buying and selling calves, an activity he’s been in for 11 years in the community where he lives.  He provides his business to people who come from various nearby places because of the quality of his products; he has much demand every week.

Adrián needs the loan to buy cattle in order to have good variety available for each of his customers.  The impact he had with the financing is that sales rose significantly because he bought much product to meet all his customers’ needs.

His plans for the future are to continue growing in his own business every day to earn good income and provide his children with a good education as well as good quality of life for him and his family.

Oscar works buying and selling pigs and Saydy works making and selling cheese.

Choluteca, Honduras - September, 2012

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Esha

texts.en:
Esha, who is 34 years old, is a widowed mother who takes care of four children. Thanks to her efforts and hard work, she has been able to take them to school. 

For the past two years, Esha has been running a food stall that is home-based. She sells a variety of African dishes.

In the past few weeks, demand for more food variety has increased, but she does not have enough capital to stock up with more ingredients like wheat flour, sugar, and food flavors.  She hopes to continue expanding her business so as to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like wheat flour, sugar, and food flavors.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel, necesita capital para invertir en su negocio de venta de comida y tortillas, por eso esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo que le ayudara en la compra de arroz, pollo, azúcar, maíz, leña, frijoles, carne, sal y todo lo necesario para realizar las comidas y la venta de tortillas, esto le ayudara a mantener el negocio y mejorar económicamente.

Ella comenta que con el préstamo anterior pudo fortalecer su negocio mediante la compra de materiales para el negocio, ella se mantiene con sus ventas para ir incrementado sus ingresos y mejorando su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Maribel needs money to invest in her business selling food and tortillas, so she is requesting another loan that will help her buy rice, chicken, sugar, maize, firewood, beans, meat, salt and other products she needs to make food and sell tortillas. It will help keep her business going and improve her financial situation. 

Maribel says that the previous loan enabled her to buy materials that then strengthened her business. She is growing her sales so she can keep increasing her income and become more financially stable.

loans.use: buy rice, chicken, sugar, maize, firewood, beans and meat.

loans.name: Leandina

texts.es:
Leandina tiene 20 años de edad, vive en la linda ciudad de chincha, la cual se caracteriza por ser la cual de grandes glorias del deporte peruano y por tener la mayor población de origen afroperuano de nuestro país, esta ciudad también es muy conocida por el don que tienen sus pobladores para la ´preparación de platillos riquísimos y también por su alegría y generosidad. Leandina en sus tiempos libres le gusta mucho ver televisión y también le gusta disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favorito el cual es la riquísima “Carapulcra con sopa seca”. Actualmente Leandina se encuentra estudiando la carrera de gastronomía y lo hace con muchas ganas.

Con mucho entusiasmo Leandina trabaja como obrera en una empresa de transporte, ella lleva trabajando desde hace 4 años en la empresa ya que desde muy joven, ella trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al dia y con el fruto de su trabajo ella puede solventar los gastos de sus estudios; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y trabajadora.

Leandina está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya es la segunda vez que le brindan su gran apoyo y gracias a ello podrá comprar materiales para sus estudios de gastronomía como libros, folletos, entre otros, así de esta manera ella podrá tener los implementos adecuados para sus clases y seguir trabajando y luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar su carrera, Tener su propio  restaurante y poder apoyar a su madre”.
texts.en:
Leandina, 20, lives in the pretty city of Chincha noted for being the birthplace of great Peruvian sports heroes and for having the country’s largest concentration of Afro-Peruvian population.  This city is also noted for the tasty way residents prepare food as well as for their joy and generosity.  

Leandina likes to watch television in her free time as well as to enjoy one of her favorite dishes, the delicious “Carapulcra con Sopa Seca.”  She’s currently studying gastronomy and she’s doing it fervently.

Leandina works with much enthusiasm as an employee for a transportation firm; she’s been working there for 4 years since she was very young.  She works about 10 hours daily and is able to pay for her schooling with the fruits of her labor.  She believes she does well at work because she’s very responsible and hardworking.

Leandina is very grateful to Kiva lenders because this is the second time they’ve given her their great support and thanks to it she will be able to buy school supplies like textbooks and pamphlets, among others, for her gastronomy courses.  In this way she will have the proper tools for her classes to continue striving and working towards making her greatest dream reality: to finish her career and have her own restaurant to be able to help out her mother.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Rigoberto Ernesto

texts.es:
Rigoberto, necesita capital para invertir en su taller de sastreria, es por ello que esta nuevamente solicitándonos un préstamo para la compra de hilos, tela, tijeras, agujas y para la reparación de la máquina de costurar y asi poder brindarles una mejor costura a sus clientes.
El nos comenta que gracias al crédito anterior aumento su negocio y de la misma forma su clientela, el sigue con su sastrería va mejorando económicamente gracias a la inversión que hiso con el crédito de kiva.
texts.en:
Rigoberto needs capital to invest in his tailoring shop. For this reason, he is requesting a new loan in order to buy thread, fabric, scissors, and needles. He will also pay for repairs to his sewing machine so that he can provide better service to his customers.

Thanks to his previous loan, Rigoberto says that his business has grown and the size of his clientele has increased. He continues to improve financially in his tailoring business thanks to the investment he has made with his Kiva loan.

loans.use: to pay for sewing machine repairs and to buy thread, fabrics, scissors, and needles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing, fashion jewelry, and home furnishings, as well as set up an area in her home for a workshop.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz, de 32 años de edad, es una mujer alegre y emprendedora.  Es conviviente, vive con su pareja y sus 02 menores hijos, por los cuales se esfuerza en salir adelante. Tiene su casa propia la cual compró con el apoyo de su pareja. El trabajo de Liz consiste en la venta de comidas, por la mañanas prepara desayunos y al medio día vende menú, en su local propia ubicado en su propia casa, negocio que abrió hace un año, tiempo en el cual le valió para hacerse conocida en la zona, contando con la apoyo de una empleada que le ayuda  en la labores de la cocina. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por la buena demanda que tiene y las ganancias que le deja. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite tener un ingreso económico que le permite tener la tranquilidad de brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus pequeños hijos, pero no le gusta que  constantemente los precios de los productos suben de precios, lo cual hace variar sus márgenes de ganancias. Pero eso no la  amilana y ella sigue esforzándose gracias a que su restaurante es muy concurrido teniendo todas la ganas de ampliar su negocio. Este es el  préstamo número 08 con la institución MFP, en todo este tiempo le va bien en su grupo y se siente muy contenta de estar en un grupo tan responsable como se muestran hasta ahora.
Con el préstamo solicitado de 1,500 nuevos  soles, víveres e ingredientes para la preparación de su comida como arroz, azucar por sacos, aceite, menestras entre otros, por que así podrá obtener menor costos y mayor ganancia.
texts.en:
Liz, 32, is a cheerful, enterprising woman.  She has a spouse and lives with her spouse and two minor children she strives for to get ahead.  She owns a house she bought with support from her spouse.  Liz’s work consists in selling food.  In the morning she makes breakfasts and at midday she prepares lunches at home; she opened the business a year ago and in this time she’s become well-known in the zone.  She has an employee that helps her do the kitchen work.  She considers her business to be quite profitable because of the high demand it has and the profits it yields.  What she likes about her work is that it makes it possible for her to earn income that gives her the peace of mind of having better quality of life for her little children.  However, she does not like the constantly rising prices of products which make her profit margin fluctuate.  This does not discourage her, though, and she continues striving because her restaurant is always crowded and she very much wants to expand it.

This is her 8th MFP loan.  She’s done very well in her group all this time and she feels very happy to be part of a group that has shown itself to be so responsible to date.

She will use the requested 1,500 new soles to buy foodstuffs and ingredients like sacks of rice and sugar, oil and vegetables, among others to prepare the meals in order to lower costs and increase profits.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and sugar, oil and vegetables.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Aminah's Group

texts.en:
Aminah's group is comprised of 3 hardworking women. Aminah is 20 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school.
