For the past 2 years, Aminah has been working hard to manage her raw food stall, where she sells and cooks matooke. 

To help expand her business, Aminah has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more matooke, and will help Aminah to generate greater profits and use the profits to pay school fees for her child. Aminah hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her capital and keep growing her business. 

Aminah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more matooke

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 23 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Shamim has been working hard to manage her small business, where she sells soft drinks and juices. 

To help expand her business, Shamim has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more soda, water and other drinks to sell, and will help Shamim to generate greater profits and use the profits to pay school fees for her children. Shamim hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Shamim is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more soda, water and other drinks to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 50 years old, married and has two children above age 18. He has been farming for 10 years. He mainly grows potatoes, tomatoes and rears dairy cows. John has employed three people on his farm. Besides, he owns rental houses and shops which earn him extra income.

Through Faulu Kenya, John has managed to expand his farm. He has also been trained on financial management. This has helped him to save a lot of money. His desire is to practice large-scale farming in the future. John needs a loan of 100,000 KES to buy a drip irrigation system and a water tank.

loans.use: To buy a drip irrigation system and a water tank

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 18 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her small food stall, which sells raw matooke and cassava. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 450,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more matooke and also sweet potatoes, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and use the profits to pay for school fees for her siblings. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business in order to gain more profits. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more matooke and also sweet potatoes

loans.name: Los Girasoles Group

texts.es: Anita tiene 32 años de edad, desde muy jovencita sus padres le inculcaron el amor por la tierra y el cómo trabajarla, ella es parte del grupo Los Girasoles y dice que le pusieron a su grupo ese nombre porque donde hacen sus reuniones del crédito hay muchas plantas de esa flor y por eso le pusieron ese nombre aparte que dice que es una de sus flores favoritas. Platica que  desde muy jovencita sus padres le enseñaron a como trabajar la tierra y también porque no tenía un trabajo seguro y por eso ella se dedico a cultivarla. Platica que desde hace mas de 11 años se dedica al cultivo de fresas ya que tiene un terreno muy amplio y para no desperdiciar el lugar se puso a sembrar, también plática que se dedica a la venta de leche, dice que tiene 8 vacas lecheras las cuales a diario ordeña a muy temprana hora y sale a vender a diferentes casas de su comunidad y de una población cercana, ella dice “gracias a los créditos que me ha hecho VisionFund mi negocio ha mejorado ya que tengo en mejores condiciones mis vacas y he podido sembrar un poco mas de fresa, por que antes no me alcanzaba con lo que me dejaba de ganancias para poder sembrar y comprar los insumos que ocupo para cultivar”. Ella platica que ahorita está pidiendo un crédito para mejorar sus plantíos de fresa y comprar los insumos que se ocupan para su buen crecimiento y también para la compra de alimento, vitaminas, desparacitantes para el buen crecimiento de las vacas lecheras que tiene y así puedan producir un poco mas de leche, dice que al día saca más o menos 250 litros y que no a todas las vacas ordeña para dejarlas descansar y produzcan más leche. Dice que su meta es aclientarse mas aunque a veces tiene pedidos grandes ella quisiera tener un puesto en el mercado de su comunidad donde pueda también hacer y vender quesos, natas, chongos (dulce regional), crema y demás productos lácteos. Las otras quince integrantes del grupo se llaman Graciela, Sofía, Gabriela, Paulina, Ysabel, Felipa, Sofía Salguero, Verónica, Teresa, Itxe Ivette, María Guadalupe, Juana, Ma. Remedios, Raquel y Mariana ellas invertirán sus créditos en artículos para surtir tienda de abarrotes, para ropa y calzado por catalogo para vender, dulces regionales, frutas y legumbres de temporada, para la compra de material para realizar guantes industriales, en refacciones para vehículos, en ropa de segunda mano, en perfumería y cosméticos para su venta y para pollo para venderlo por kilos.
texts.en:
Anita is 32 years old. When she was a little girl her parents instilled in her a love of the earth and taught her how to work with it. Now, Anita is part of the group called Los Girasoles (in English: Sunflowers), which happen to be one of Anita's favorite flowers. As a young girl, Anita's parents taught her how to work on the land. Later, since she had not found any other steady job, she decided to dedicate herself to farming. 

For the last 11 years, Anita has worked growing strawberries because she owns a wide plot of land that she doesn't want to waste. She also works selling milk. Anita has eight milking cows that she wakes up early each day to milk. She sells their milk to various families in her community and in a nearby town. 

Anita says that, "Thanks to the loans that I have received from VisionFund, my business has improved, my cows are in better condition, and I have been able to grow more strawberries. Before, my earnings were not enough to sow more and to buy the fertilizers needed to grow them." Now, Anita is requesting a loan in order to improve her strawberry crop and to buy fertilizers to help them grow. She will also buy food, vitamins, and de-wormers for her milk cows in order to produce more milk. Currently, she gets about 250 liters each day because she cannot milk all of the cows at once. She must let them rest so they will produce more milk. 

Anita's goal is to increase the number of customers she serves. She would like to have a permanent spot in the market in her community where she could also make and sell cheeses, creams, sweet buns, and other dairy products. 

The other 15 members of Los Girasoles are Graciela, Sofía, Gabriela, Paulina, Ysabel, Felipa, Sofía Salguero, Verónica, Teresa, Itxe Ivette, María Guadalupe, Juana, Ma. Remedios, Raquel y Mariana. They will use their portions of the loan to stock a grocery store; to buy clothing and shoes to sell; to buy regional sweets, seasonal fruits and vegetables; to buy materials to make work gloves; for vehicle alterations; to obtain second-hand clothing; to buy perfumes and cosmetics to sell; and to buy chicken to sell by the pound.

loans.use: to buy food for her cows and fertilizer to grow strawberries.

loans.name: Celia  Jannet

texts.es: Cecilia tiene 37 años estado civil soltera, tiene 2 hijas .Cecilia comenta  que a causa de la falta de empleo que posee el país y no podía encontrar un trabajo fijo, tomo  el rumbo de ser una comerciante mas del país. Pero uno de sus mayores impedimentos es la  falta de capital, pues lo que  ella vende  es  ropa . Con el préstamo Cecilia va a comprar: abrigos, blusas, pantalones, camisetas  vestidos etc.
texts.en: Cecilia, 37, is single and has two daughters.  Cecilia comments that due to the lack of employment in the country and being unable to secure a job she decided to become one more merchant in the country.  But one of her greatest obstacles is lack of capital because what she sells is clothes.  Cecilia will use the loan to buy coats, blouses, pants, T-shirts, dresses, etc.

loans.use: to buy coats, blouses, pans, T-shirts, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en: Bosco is a 32-year-old, married man with four children living in Masindi, Uganda. For 5 years, he has been operating a bar business. He started the bar after realizing that farming was seasonal and the income earned could not sustain them daily. He raised capital from farming and charcoal trading. Inadequate capital to purchase stock hinders his business. Bosco’s dream is to educate his children up to the university and expand his business to new markets. He is requesting a loan to buy soda and beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy soda and beer to sell.

loans.name: Gs Triunfo Centro No. 3 Group

texts.es:
Don José es una persona muy trabajadora honesta y responsable vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en el municipio del Triunfo al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es una pulpería.
Don José el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de: arroz, azúcar, manteca, frijoles, café, pan queso, mantequilla, refrescos, etc. Con el préstamo el espera incrementar sus ventas al tener más  variedad  y cantidad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes y satisfacer sus necesidades  al igual que con los ingresos satisfacer las necesidades de la familia y mejorar el estilo de vida de la misma.
En el  futuro Don José el espera que su negocio crezca y se convierta en el más grande y conocido de la zona y con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y mas a sus hijos a que terminen sus estudios y se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades.
Doña María tiene 53 años de edad su negocio es la venta de variedades en el centro de municipio del Triunfo desde ya hace 20 años.
Don Saturnino tiene 57 años de edad su negocio es el servicio de moto taxis en el municipio del Triunfo.
Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre 2012
texts.en:
José is a very hardworking, honest, responsible person.  He lives with his wife and three children in the town of Triunfo in southern Honduras.  His business is a grocery store.

José needs the loan to buy rice, sugar, lard, beans, coffee, bread, cheese, butter, soft-drinks, etc.  He expects the loan will lead to increased sales by having more variety and quantity of products available to offer his customers to meet their needs as well as to meet his family’s needs with income earned and to improve their quality of life.

In the future, José hopes his business will grow and become the biggest and best-known in the zone to be able to continue supporting his family and in addition that his children complete their schooling and become upstanding citizens with better opportunities.

María, 53, has been selling miscellaneous merchandise in downtown Triunfo for 20 years and Saturnino, 57, provides mototaxi service in Triunfo.

Choluteca, Honduras - September, 2012

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Darlys

texts.es: Darly  con su previo credikiva, compró víveres, frutas y verduras, con los cuales aumentó  el surtido y las ventas y las utilidades. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará refrescos, bebidas y víveres en mayor volumen. Su inversión tendrá éxito, porque fue trasladado al corregimiento de Salgar y allí tiene una buena clientela, especialmente de turistas, pues este lugar está ubicado a la orilla del mar, donde hay mucha afluencia de visitantes locales,  nacionales e internacionales. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Estoy agradecida por la ayuda recibida y espero compensar el favor recibido pagando puntualmente
texts.en: With her previous Kiva loan, Darly purchased grocery products, fruits, and vegetables with which she varied her product offering and increased sales.  She is applying for another Kiva loan which she will use to purchase beverages, drinks, and other grocery products in higher volume.  Her investment will be successful because she moved it to the town of Salgar where she has a strong customer base especially tourists as this town is located next to the sea where there is a lot of domestic and international tourism.  Her message to the people of Kiva is this: "I am very grateful for your help and I hope to repay you in a timely manner".

loans.use: to purchase beverages, drinks, and other grocery products in higher volume.

loans.name: Sigaran Indah Group

texts.en:
Bali is a tourism island, but looking at particular districts we will see that there are so many rural communities dependent not only on tourism, but on breeding animals and farming as well. This female group in Sigaran village, central Bali, joined MUK to get a loan, uniquely for Pig breeding. 

Ni Made, as a housewife in Bali, is used to keeping pigs at home to support the family's income, on top of her husband's income. But the problem is most of the group do not know the correct way of raising pigs. To improve their skills, they formed a group. In addition to exchanging information, they also apply for loans. Ni Made, 41 years old, become the head of the Sigaran Indah group to enhance their capacity in terms of raising pigs and raising capital for the business. The loan proposed by the group Sigaran Indah will be used to buy two superior piglets, and the rest spent on buying feed. In a period of 6 months, the pigs will be ready for sale. The profits gained from this effort will be used entirely to support the economy of the family.

loans.use: To buy two superior piglets and feed

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es: Kelly, de 47 años de edad, es una mujer alegre y entusiasta.  Es docente de profesión y del que actualmente lo ejerce, sin embargo se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Vive en su propia casa con sus padres, sus 02 hermanos, y su hijo mayor de edad. Para ella el vender cosméticos es muy agradable, es así que previamente se apoya de catalogos y del que personalmente propone a sus amistades y conocidos estos productos, dándoles a crédito hasta por 15 días. Se dedica  a ésta actividad  hace más de 03 años y le va muy bien, y esto es debido por la demanda que tiene de sus productos. Le gusta su trabajo pues le da un ingreso extra y así mejora su economía , le deja tiempo libre y le ha permitido hacerse conocida en el circulo social que se desenvuelve.  Tiene planes de crecer  y abrir un local de venta de perfumería y cosméticos, por ello agradece a la institución MFP por los préstamo otorgado, y una vez más se compromete en ser puntual con este ultimo crédito. Por otro lado, se siente bien y satisfecha con su grupo de su banco comunal, lo considera un  grupo responsable que se preocupa por el bienestar de sus miembros y la puntualidad de sus pagos. Con el préstamo solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, comprará cosmético, perfumes de diversas presentaciones en mayor volumen, de esa manera tener en stock para cuando el cliente lo requiera.
texts.en:
Kelly, 47, is a cheerful, enthusiastic woman.  She’s a teacher by profession and currently is exercising it.  However, she also sells cosmetics.   

She lives in her own house with her parents, two brothers and her adult son.  For her, selling cosmetics is very enjoyable.  She uses catalogues to offer products to her friends and acquaintances personally and offers up to 15 days credit.  She’s been in this business for three years and does very well because of the demand her products have.  

She likes her work because it provides extra income and she improves her economy this way.  It gives her free time and it has made her well-known in the social circle she belongs to.  She plans to grow and to open a locale to sell perfume and cosmetics so she is grateful to MFP for the loan granted and once again promises to be punctual with this latest loan.  On the other hand, she feels good and satisfied with her group in the communal bank.  She considers it to be a responsible group that’s concerned for the wellbeing of its members and with the punctuality of their payments.  

She will use the requested 2,000 new soles to buy cosmetics and perfumes in a variety of presentations in larger amounts to have on hand when her customers require them.

loans.use: to buy perfume and cosmetics.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dolores Maribel

texts.es: Dolores tiene 35 años de edad estado civil divorciada tiene 3 hijos. Dolores cuenta que comenzó con esta actividad por la falta de desempleo que existe en el país ya que ella quería encontrar trabajo pero no encontró. Pues fue ahí entonces que decidió vender todo lo referente a cosméticos y le ha ido muy bien, la cual trabaja en las tardes a ofrecer a sus vecinos los productos que posee. Su sueño es vender ropa también como blusa , faldas etc. Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar: perfume, cremas, colonias, desodorantes, talcos etc.
texts.en: Dolores is 35 years old and divorced. She has 3 children.  Dolores started her business due to the lack of employment opportunities in her country, as she wanted to find work but could not. It was then that she decided to start selling all sorts of cosmetics. It is going well for her. She works in the afternoons and offers her products to her neighbours. Her dream is to be able to sell clothes such as shirts, skirts etc. She will use the loan to buy perfumes, creams, colognes, deodorants, talcum powders etc.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, colognes, deodorants, talcum powders etc

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is 35 years old and is blessed with one child. Where she lives there aren't many sari-sari stores, so Madelyn grabbed the opportunity to establish a retail store. Here, she sells food and daily commodities to the villagers. This has been a great help to her family. Even though sometimes, she encountered some problems, due to her patience and hard work she has continuously generated income.

Madelyn is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy bread, eggs, vinegar, sweets, biscuits and sugar to sell in her store. She would like to stock more items in her store to satisfy her customers' demand. She hopes to expand her sales and profits through the loan, to make her family economically secure and prepare for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy bread, eggs, vinegar, sweets, biscuits and sugar

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
This is Nancy, 50, resident of Bacoor, Philippines. Her husband is a driver and she is a mother to her children. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Nancy maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. A customers order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealers' prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing as their income. Nancy's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of 18,000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Nancy hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams to have a good life for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise needed for her business.

loans.name: Ronilo

texts.en:
Ronilo is a loving father of two. He is now 36 years old and married to a housewife. She is also his partner in the hog raising business. 

He has been raising hogs to fatten and breed for eight years now, and earns about 3,000 PHP for each hog sold. He is now asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy an additional hog, its feed, and vaccines for sustainability. Hogs will be sold at higher cost if they attain the desired weight. From this income, Ronilo will continuously pay the school expenses of his children. Education will be the greatest legacy he can pass onto them.

loans.use: to buy additional hog, as well as its feed and vaccines.

loans.name: Dominador

texts.en:
Dominador is 45 years old and has one child. He is a tricyle (motorcycle) operator from Linao East. He provides motorcycle transport to the people in his village. He has had this business for 10 years now.

Dominador is now asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy gasoline and repair existing vehicle trouble. This will help continue the smooth flow of his operation and also gain income for the education of his child.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and repair existing vehicle trouble.

loans.name: Reiravmandraa

texts.en: Mrs Reiravmandraa is 46 years old and lives with her husband in a small house in Han-Uul district, Mongolia. Her husband, Munhbat, is 47 years old. He works as a security officer in a Security company. Reiravmandraa has been tailoring Mongolian traditional clothes since 1997 at her home, and selling to individuals by order. She has a rented stall at a shopping center to market her business to the public. She said "I want to redesign my house and garden and grow old with all my grandchildren around me playing". She is requesting 5,000,000MNT to redesign and insulate her house in order to prevent heat loss and get more comfortable.

loans.use: To redesign and insulate her house

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 45 years old and happily married to Nestor. They have three children. Rosalia raises hogs and sells them for profits. She is now raising three hogs that need sustenance.

Rosalia hopes to make her business profitable so she is now asking for a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy feed and vaccines for hog maintenance. Additional revenue generated will be invested in the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for hog maintenance.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 50 years old, married and has two children. She is cooking and selling boiled eggs and hot dogs to the people in her village. She has been cooking and selling these foods for over eight years now and gains 300 Philippines pesos (P) each day. 

She is asking for additional capital of P7,000 to invest in making the business grow. She will buy eggs, hot dogs and bananas to cook and sell. She hopes to keep offering delicious snacks and good services to all her valued customers and gain additional income from it.

loans.use: to buy eggs, hot dogs and bananas to cook and sell.

loans.name: Mi Niño Jesus Iv Programa Group

texts.es:
¡Saludos desde Perú! La Sra. Emma es integrante del grupo “MI NIÑO JESUS IV PROGRAMA”, el cual está conformado por 5 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Emma tiene 27 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos (Uno de 10 años y uno recién nacido). Ella se caracteriza por ser una persona luchadora y emprendedora, se dedica diariamente a la venta de ropa por pedidos y productos de belleza. El préstamo solicitado es para poder comprar mercadería por campaña navideña. Su sueño es un día lograr tener una boutique y su casa propia. Gracias a su dedicación, Emma ha logrado contribuir en los gastos del hogar y siempre busca la manera de seguir saliendo adelante junto a su esposo e hijos. La Sra. Emma está muy contenta con este préstamo y agradece a Edaprospo y a Kiva por la confianza brindada.

*La Sra. Emma es aquella que tiene en brazos a su hijo recien nacido.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru!  Emma is a member of the Mi Niño Jesús IV Programa.  The group is comprised of five members who devote themselves to various business activities.

Emma, age 27, is married and has two children.  (One is ten years old, and the other is a newborn.)  Emma is known for being a tenacious and enterprising person.  She works every day selling clothes by order and beauty products.

The requested loan is to be able to buy merchandise for the Christmas season.  Her dream is to have a boutique one day and her own house.

Thanks to her diligence, Emma has managed to contribute to the household expenses.  She is always looking for a way to get ahead with her husband and children.  Emma is very happy with this loan, and she is grateful to Edaprospo and Kiva for the trust that has been afforded to her.

*Emma is the one with her newborn baby in her arms.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Hope

texts.en:
This is Hope. She previously accessed a 24,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and for her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 24,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Hope hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to give her children a quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she also draws strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
JUAN CARLOS tiene 30 años de edad es casado no tiene hijos viven en la ciudad de Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

JUAN CARLOS es diseñador gráfico realiza trabajos de diseño gràfico y fotografía, el trabaja independientemente a su cuenta. Solicita el crédito para comprar proyector de imagenes y fotografía. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá adquirir implementos tegnològicos. La compra lo hará en la ciudad de Quito. 

El sueño para la familia es brindarle una mejor calidad de vida y estabilidad económica, respecto al negocio posicionarme en el mercado, y el sueño personal desempeñarce en el mercado cómo fotoggrafo y diseño gráfico. 
 
En el tiempo libre le gusta disfrutar de paseos con la familia y realizar actividades para fomentar la unión familiar.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 30 years old, married, and has no children. He and his wife live in the city of Guaranda in Bolívar Province.

Juan Carlos is a graphic designer who performs graphic design and photography jobs. He works independently of his own accord. Juan Carlos is requesting a loan in order to by an image and photo projector. With the help of this loan, he will be able to acquire technological equipment. This purchase will be made in the city of Quito.

His dream for his family is to provide them a better quality of life and financial stability. With respect to his business and his position in the marketplace, he hopes to develop as a photographer and a graphic designer.

In his free time, Juan Carlos enjoys spending time with his family and participating in activities that encourage family unity.

loans.use: to purchase an image and photo projector.

loans.name: Ingris

texts.es: Ingris de 34 años de edad, tiene un negocio ubicado en el centro de la ciudad, donde vende mercancía variada como gorros, gafa, correas  y compact disk, a clientes que usualmente visitan el centro de la ciudad. Desde muy joven se dedicó a la actividad comercial, vendiendo bocadillos y poco a poco fue ampliando su inventario, pues se le presentó la oportunidad de comprar una colmena (puesto de ventas),  en el mercado que surtió con otros productos ya mencionados. Todos los días desde la 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche Ingris atiende su negocio y ofrece artículos, que algunas veces compra a crédito y otras de contado, es decir no todas las veces encuentra buenos precios, por no comprar en volumen cuando existen posibilidades de descuentos, debido a que no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente para hacerlo. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará correas, discos compactos, gorros y así tendrá mucha diversidad en sus inventarios, y esto es justamente lo que hace que su inversión de su credikiva sea exitosa.
texts.en:
Ingris is 34 years old and has a business located in the city center, where she sells varied merchandise such as hats, glasses, belts, and compact disks, to customers who frequently visit the city center. From a young age she was a businesswoman, selling bocadillos [guava jelly] and gradually expanded her inventory. She got the opportunity to buy a colmena [sales stall] in a market and then stocked it with other products already mentioned.

Every day Ingris serves her business and offers articles from 7:00 am to 7:00 pm. Sometimes she buys on credit and others in cash. In other words, not all the times she finds good prices because she can't buy in volume when there are discounts because she doesn't have enough working capital to do so. This is why she is applying for a Kiva loan, first financing she makes to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy belts, compact disks, hats, so she will have a lot of diversity in her inventories. This is precisely what will make the investment of her Kiva loan successful.

loans.use: to buy belts, CDs, and hats.

loans.name: Ninoska Patricia

texts.es: Ninoska invirtió su previo Kiva en la compra de jeanes y blusas para damas, caballeros e infantil. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará calzado para todos los gustos en las familias y ropa en general. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Muchas gracias por creer en mi y apoyarme para fortalecer mi negocio. “
texts.en:
Ninoska used her previous Kiva loan to buy jeans and blouses for adults and children.  She is currently applying for a Kiva loan to buy shoes to suit every taste and clothes in general.

Her message to the Kiva lenders is the following:  “Many thanks for believing in me and for helping me strengthen my business”.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a generous mother. She is 49 years old, has six children and operates a business of cooking and selling snacks out of glutinous rice. She also has a small store which offers grocery items to the people in her neighborhood. She would like to further improve her sales and cook more delectable snacks so she is borrowing PHP 9,000 and investing it in buying coconut, glutinous rice and flour used in her food selling business.

In the future, Edna would like to achieve a fortunate life for her family.

loans.use: to buy coconut, glutinous rice and flour used in her food selling business.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 28 years old, and happily married to Elviro. They have had no child yet but are praying to have one soon. She is raising hogs to fatten and breed and resells them to butchers for income while her spouse does farming business too. Together they generate income to sustain their needs. She is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy feed and medicine for the hogs. This will ensure healthy hogs and someday she can offer them at profitable cost. 

Maricel hopes to became a successful hog raiser and gain a stable income to achieve economic stability someday.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for the hogs

loans.name: Damaris Argentina

texts.es:
La joven Damaris es una persona muy trabajadora dedicada a su negocio, vive con 3 hijos en el departamento de Choluteca en el sur de Honduras. Ella tiene más de 10 años de tener este tipo de negocio.
Damaris el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de ropa americana como pantalones, camisas, blusas, calzonetas, faldas y otros articules de uso personal. de esta manera incrementar más sus ventas. Con el préstamo espera incrementar sus ventas y asi atender mejor a sus clientes.
Damaris espera tener mejores ingresos para tener mejor forma de vida. Sus sueños es poder incrementar su negocio y poder ayudar a sus hijos y a sus padres.
Choluteca, Honduras - Septiembre del 2012
texts.en:
Damaris is a very hardworking young person who is dedicated to her business.  She lives with three children in the department of Choluteca in the south of Honduras.  She has had this type of business for more than 10 years.

Damaris is going to invest the loan in buying clothing from the United States such as pants, shirts, blouses, underwear, skirts, and other personal products.  This way she'll increase her sales and better serve her customers.

Damaris hopes to have better income to have a better way of life.  Her dreams are to be able to expand her business and help her children and her parents.

Choluteca, Honduras, September 2012

loans.use: to buy clothing from the United States and personal products

loans.name: Maknuna

texts.ru: Макнуне 27 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Она студентка 5 курса. Макнуна учится в Таджикском  Государственном Университете по специальности Финансы и кредит. Она учится на отлично и активно участвует в общественной жизни университета. В будущем она мечтает стать известном финансистом. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора в 2012-2013 учебного года. Так как ее муж не в состоянии оплатить за учебу Макнуны, Вы являетесь единственными людьми, кто может подержать ее. Она ждет вашу доброту
texts.en:
Maknuna is 27 and married with one child. She is in her fifth year of college. Maknuna studies Finance and Credit at the Tajik State University. She is a straight A student and is active in student life. Maknuna's dream is to become a famous financier in the future.
She is requesting a loan to pay her tuition in the 2012-2013 school year. Since Maknuna's husband is not able to cover her tuition, you are her only resource. She appreciates your kindness.

loans.use: to pay her tuition

loans.name: Julio Temistocles

texts.es: Temistocles  tiene 53 años estado civil casado tiene 4 hijos .empezó con su negocio propio porque  la situación económica estaba difícil para su familia pero con esfuerzos salió adelante y ahora Temistocles trabaja para darle un buen futuro a sus hijos él es  comerciante de frutas y legumbres. Su esposa lo ayuda todos los días. Con el préstamo el va a comprar : frutas , legumbres  etc.
texts.en:
Temistocles, 53, is married and has four children.  He started his own business because the economic situation was difficult for his family.  With effort he got ahead, though, and now Temistocles works to give his children a good future.  He sells fruits and vegetables.  His wife helps him every day.

With the loan he's going to buy fruits, vegetables, etc.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Johana Jessica

texts.es: Jessica de estado civil casado, tiene 2 hijos .Ella realizo curso informáticos cuando era joven por eso se decidió a ponerse un cyber y lo consiguió , porque en la actualidad Jessica tiene un cyber , la cual atiende sola , y trabaja de 13:00pm hasta 22:00pm.Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar : mas computadoras
texts.en: Jessica is married with two children. She took IT courses when she was younger, and for that reason she decided to start an internet cafe, which she was able to achieve. She currently has an internet cafe, which she tends by herself, and works from 1 p.m. until 10 p.m. With the loan, she plans to purchase more computers.

loans.use: to purchase more computers.

loans.name: Emy

texts.en:
Emy is 43 years old, has three children, and manages a small barber shop in their village for income. He offers haircuts and shaves. He had been in his business for about five years now. He wanted to improve his services that is why he is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 as additional capital in buying new scissors and towels to use in his barber shop.

Someday, with the good and high quality of services from the business, he will able to acquire good profits too. He will invest it in paying the school fees of his children.

loans.use: to buy new scissors, towels and towels use in his barber shop.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 50 years old and is married to Felomino, a farmer in the village. Marilyn is engaged in a hog-raising business. She has had this business for four years and earns about PHP 5,000 per hog every disposing season. Her ambition in life is to improve the status of living for her family. Now, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs in order to increase her sales at disposing time. Hopefully, it will provide her a great help.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs

loans.name: Jonathan Gabriel

texts.es: Jonathan tiene 21 años estado civil soltero, no tiene hijos. El padre de Jonathan le ayudo a comprarse un carro y como no conseguía trabajo se puso como a trabajar como taxista. Jonathan sale a trabajar desde las 6.00am hasta 19:00pm. Uno de sus principales temores es la delincuencia que se vive en su ciudad: Con el préstamo él quiere arreglar el carro
texts.en:
Jonathan, 21, is single and has no children.  His father helped him buy a car and since he wasn't getting a job he began to work as a taxi driver.  Jonathan works from 6 a.m. until 7 p.m.  One of his main fears is the crime that exists in his city.

With the loan he wants to repair his car.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Maritza Monserrate

texts.es: Maritza de estado civil soltero, tiene 2 hijos. Desde que se separo  de su esposo tuvo que conseguir el sustento de vida para sus hijos. Por lo que logro poder poner su negocio de asadero de pollos .Su trabajo la realiza de 11:00am hasta 21:00pm contrato una ayudante para que se encargue de la cocina. Con el préstamo va a comprar: mesas, sillas, pollos etc.
texts.en: Maritza is single and has two children. After she separated from her husband, she needed to find a way to provide for her children, and she was able to set up a food stand selling roasted chicken. She works from 11 a.m. until 9 p.m. and has an employee who is in charge of the kitchen. With the loan, she plans to purchase tables, chairs, chickens, etc.

loans.use: to purchase tables, chairs, chickens, etc.

loans.name: Maura Estela

texts.es:
La Señora Maura Estela posee un negocio de venta de comida, ropa y cosmético  en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León, ella realiza esta labor para llevar el sustento a su familia. 

La Señora se traslada de su casa de habitación a las 3:30 am. Abre su negocio a las 4:00 am  inicia a preparar los deliciosos platillos y finaliza a las 3:00 pm. Sus principales clientes son  comerciantes del mercado, además la Señora Vende ropa y cosméticos, esta labor la realiza con ayuda de sus cuatro hijas.   

El  crédito que esta solicitando a Ceprodel será utilizado para compra de Arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, pollo, carne de res, ropa  y cosméticos  para así ofrecerle a su clientela una variedad de productos de mejor calidad para satisfacer la demanda por lo que tendría más ingresos para mejorar su nivel de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Maura Estela has a business selling food, clothing and cosmetics at one of the city markets in León. She carries out this work in order to provide for her family. She leaves her home at 3:30 a.m. to open her business at 4 a.m. to start preparing delicious dishes that she serves until 3 p.m. Her main customers are the market merchants. She also sells clothing and cosmetics, which she does with the help of her four children. She is requesting the loan from Kiva partner Ceprodel to purchase rice, beans, sugar, oil, chicken, meat, clothing and cosmetics so she can offer her customers a variety of high-quality products to meet demand. In this way she will have more income to improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, sugar, oil, chicken, meat, clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Esperanza Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Esperanza del Socorro es comerciante de uno de los Mercados de la ciudad de León, abre su negocio a las 6 am. Para realizar la venta de hielo y bolsas plásticas a las además comerciante en especial a las que vende marisco, posteriormente se dedica a  la recuperación de cartera de la venta de electrodoméstico que realiza al crédito y finalizan a las 4 pm.
 Viaja a la ciudad de Managua una vez por semana a comprar  su producto. Ella es madre de seis  hijos mayores de edad de los cuales ni uno está a su cargo,  Inicio su negocio vendiendo ropa ambulante.

El crédito que solicita a Ceprodel lo utilizara para la compra de nuevos productos tales  como televisor y equipo de sonidos sombrías grandes la cual son utilizadas por las comerciantes.

Los sueños de la señora es lograr concluir con las mejoras de su vivienda.
texts.en: Esperanza is a merchant at one of the city markets in León. She opens her business at 6 a.m. to sell ice and plastic bags to the merchants who sell seafood, and later on she sells household appliances on credit before she finishes up at 4 p.m. She travels to the city of Managua once a week to purchase her merchandise. She is a mother of six children, all grown up and independent. She started her business selling clothes on the street. She is requesting the loan from Kiva partner Ceprodel to purchase new products such as televisions and sound equipment that can be used by the merchants. Her dream is to finish making improvements to her home.

loans.use: to purchase televisions and sound equipment.

loans.name: Andrea Justina

texts.es:
La señora Andrea Justina  es  propietaria de un negocio de venta de ropa donde oferta diferentes tipos de productos como mosquiteros, ropa interior para damas y caballeros, colchas. Su día de trabajo empieza muy temprano, ordenando sus productos desde las 8 de la mañana en el puesto que posee en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León para posteriormente con mucha emoción y energía ofrece sus productos a su fiel clientela.

 Actualmente está solicitando un crédito, el cual invertirá directamente en la compra de ropa interior  para damas, caballeros y niño, mosquiteros, toallas de baño y de manos, colchas. Al obtener dicho crédito espera incremetar el  margen de ganancias y  surtir su negocio de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida propia y la de su familia.

La señora Andrea está muy agradecida con nuestra institucion ya que le ha ayudado a crecer en su negocio y poder salir adelante con su familia brindándole una mejor educación y formación a sus hijos.
texts.en: Andrea Justina owns a business selling clothing and different kinds of products like mosquito nets, undergarments for men and women, and bedspreads. Her workday starts very early. She sets up her merchandise at 8 a.m. at a sales post in one of the city markets of León, and she later offers those items with a lot of energy and emotion to her faithful customers. She is requesting the loan to purchase undergarments for men, women and children, mosquito nets, bath towels, and bedspreads. With the loan, she hopes to expand her profit margins and stock her business, and in this way improve the quality of life for herself and her family. Andrea is very grateful to Kiva partner Ceprodel, since it has helped her grow her business and make headway for her family, allowing her to provide her children with a better education.

loans.use: to purchase undergarments, mosquito nets, towels and bedspeads.

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Adamu is 45 years old. He is married with fourteen children, eight of whom are adopted. They live in Masindi, Uganda.

For thirty years, Adamu has been a farmer and, with the proceeds, he has been able to pay school fees for the children and buy more land to farm on. Just like most farmers in a developing world, he lacks skilled manpower and must deal with price fluctuation. These challenges notwithstanding, he hopes to educate his children up to the university level and hire employees to help modernize his farming activities.

Adamu is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Segunda

texts.en:
This is Segunda. She previously accessed a 13,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more stocks of mineral water needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 13,000 PHP loan to buy additional stocks of mineral water needed in her business. The more mineral water displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Segunda dreams of expanding her business and hopes to give a good future to her children through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have a growing network of customers. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, which is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stocks of mineral water needed in her business.

loans.name: Sarantuya

texts.en: Mrs. Sarantuya is 43 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a Ger (a traditional Mongolian home) in Hovd province, Mongolia. Her husband, Bat-Ochir, is 47 years old. He is agrarian. Her oldest daughter, Anhbolor, is 21 years old. Her youngest daughter, Oyuntungalag, is 17 years old. Her son, Otgonbayar, is 11 years old. They study at college and secondary school. Mrs. Sarantuya started a taxi service business in 2008 and she and her husband also grow vegetables in their 1 hectare garden. They harvest around 15 tons of vegetables per year. She and her husband sell their vegetables in the market. She is a clever and hardworking woman. She is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to purchase seeds and other necessary things for year's plantation.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and other necessary things for this year's plantation

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic is 21 years old, and has three children. She is married to Almax. To supplement her spouse's income, she is selling dimsum and other food products as snacks to the people in her village. She had been doing this for three years. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy hot dogs, fish balls and bananas to cook and sell. She would like offer more delicious foods to increase her income, too. Someday, giving a good education to her children will be her greatest achievement in life.

loans.use: to buy hot dogs, fish balls and bananas to cook and sell

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
This is Minerva. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used for upgrades and repairs to the cars that she sells. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for upgrades and repairs to the cars that she sells. His profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Minerva dreams of expanding her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for upgrades and repairs to the cars that she sells

loans.name: Cristopher

texts.en: Christopher is an industrious man who sells bananaque (a banana-based snack), hotdogs and glutinous rice desserts to the people in his village. His mother cooks these snacks, and he sells them for profits. He would like to keep selling good products so he is now asking additional capital of PHP 5,000 to buy bananas and hot dogs to sell. In the future, Christopher would like to keep making the business grow, earn a stable income, and help improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy bananas and hot dogs to sell

loans.name: Mertha Sedana Group

texts.en:
The Mertha Sedana Group continues to borrow loans to increase their business. They now have 2,500,000 IDR per member. On the day of the photograph, one of the members couldn't attend because of illness and is represented by her husband.

Ni Ketut--head of the group--will use this loan to purchase three piglets and their feed. She hopes that, from the pig business, she will be able to build a new kitchen.

loans.use: To buy three piglets and food for them.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
This is Melinda. She previously accessed a 13,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Melinda hopes to expand her business, she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, which is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Hung

texts.en: Hung is requesting a new loan to buy good quality ingredients to cook crab noodle soup to sell. This purchase will help him to better attract and satisfy his customers. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business. He hopes that his new loan will assist him in increasing the size of his food stall, increasing sales, and improving his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy good quality ingredients to cook crab noodle soup to sell.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong is requesting a new loan to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment and materials. Huong's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment and materials.

loans.name: Cresilda

texts.en:
This is Cresilda: 36, resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is a mother and is married to Santiago. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while running the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Cresilda sells bedding and mattresses. She makes and manufactures the bedding and mattresses, with the help of her husband. Customers buy their products because they're cheaper than those in the mall. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, Cresilda is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan to buy foam, cloth, plastic, rugby and other materials to expand her product inventory. She expects an income boost as she expands her business. Cresilda hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of giving her children a good, quality education.

She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. It is a place where she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for foam, cloth, plastic, rugby and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
This is Corazon. She previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 45,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The loan will also be used in her canteen in buying more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Corazon hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van is requesting a new loan to buy shampoo, cosmetics, and nail polish to serve her customers. Van's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, cosmetics, and nail polish to serve her customers.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en: Thu is requesting a new loan to buy shampoos, cosmetics, nail polish and materials. Thu's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy shampoos, cosmetics, nail polish and materials.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz 40 años convive con su pareja Víctor, con quien trajo al mundo a dos lindas hijas: kelly de 19 años y la pequeña Nallely de 4 añitos. Este hogar habita actualmente en una casa hecha de material noble que la pareja hizo con mucho esfuerzo. Desde hace 20 años Beatriz tiene consigo a su cargo un negocio de frutas que ella impulso debido a una época en que la familia no pasaba por un buen momento económico. Así es como en un paradero de transporte interprovincial de la cuidad optó por establecerse junto a otras vendedoras con las cuales llegaron hasta hoy, formar un grupo sólido dedicados al rubro. Con el apoyo de su esposo quien a su vez impulsa una pequeña tienda de golosinas, Beatriz puede desempeñar su actividad sin inconvenientes ya que él es quien ayuda a cargar los sacos de frutas frescas que llegan por parte de sus proveedores. A su vez comenta que le agrada mucho su trabajo ya que siente la satisfacción de ofrecer los mejores productos de la zona a los viajeros y visitantes quienes  muy agradecidos por la calidad la felicitan también por su buen trato. 
En la actualidad Beatriz tiene pensado realizar el tarrajeo de su casa  para así poder en todo caso alquilarlo o sacarle algún provecho. Con su préstamo número 03 se siente agradecida una vez mas por la confianza  brindada y se compromete a ser cumplida como siempre , agradece también a sus compañeros de su banco comunal quienes son personas muy educadas y motivadoras.
Con los 2,000 realizara el tarrajeo de su casa, pues ya esta planeando la contrata de los maestros y comprar materiales para el mismo ,  el dinero que reste lo invertirá en su negocio de frutas.
texts.en:
Beatriz, 40, lives with her partner, Victor, with whom she has brought two lovely daughters into the world:  Kelly, 19, and little Nallely, 4.  She currently lives in a house made of good material that the couple built with a lot of hard work.  For 20 years, Beatriz has had a fruit business, which she started when the family was going through a bad economic time.  This is how she decided to establish her business at an interprovincial transport stop with other businesswomen.  They have formed a solid group dedicated to their work.  With the help of her husband, who has a small candy store, she can perform her work without problems, since it is Victor who helps her carry the sacks of fresh fruit that arrive from their vendors.  She is very happy with her job since she is satisfied with offering the best products in the area to travelers and visitors who are very thankful for the quality, and they also congratulate her on her good service.

Currently, Beatriz is thinking about plastering the walls of her home to be able to rent it out to get some benefit out of it.  This is her third loan, and she is thankful once again for the confidence given to her.  She promises to make her payments like always.  She is also thankful to the other members of her communal bank, who are very educated and motivating people.

She will use the 2,000 PEN to plaster the walls of her home.  She is planning on hiring the workers and buying the materials.  She will invest the rest of her money in her fruit business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her home and fruits to stock her business.

loans.name: Londra Moncerrate

texts.es: Londra tiene46 años estado civil casada ,tiene 1 hijo .Ella cuenta que comenzó con esta actividad por la falta de desempleo que existe en el país ya que ella quería encontrar trabajo pero no encontró. Pues fue ahí entonces que decidió vender  todo lo referente a cosméticos y le ha ido muy bien, la cual trabaja en las tardes a ofrecer a sus vecinos los productos que posee. Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar .perfume, cremas, colonias, desodorantes, talcos etc.
texts.en: Londra is 46 years old, married, and has one son. She says that she started this activity because of the lack of employment that exists in the country. She wanted to find work but did not find it. It was then that she decided to sell everything related to cosmetics, and it has gone well for her. She works in the afternoon to offer the products for her neighbors. With the loan she wants to buy perfume, creams, colognes, deodorants, and talcum powder.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, colognes, deodorants, talcum powder, etc.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en: During the six years she has operated her retail shop business, Magdalena has experienced success. However, there are factors contributing to downturns in her business. Aside from low income, she also rarely experiences lack of capitalization. With this situation, she is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase cup noodles, soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods, cooking ingredients, sugar, cooking oil, milk and detergent soap for her grocery store. She hopes that with this loan she will be able to enlarge the store, offer more services to her customers and earn a higher income to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase cup noodles, soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods, cooking ingredients, sugar, cooking oil, milk and detergent soap.

loans.name: Gudilia

texts.es: Gudilia de 33 años, es soltera y madre de dos menores : Katherine y Antonio ambos con 11 y 5 años de edad respectivamente , juntos conforman un hogar. Hace poco le dieron la titulaciónd e su propiedad a base de madera. Como toda madre impulsadora de su familia, ella optó desde hace 10 años en enfrentar a la vida logrando establecer a puro esfuerzo propio su negocio de frutas que se convertiría en adelante en un buen sustento para su familia ,laborando sola y teniendo siempre el mejor apoyo que existe por parte de sus hijos. Por otro lado, tiene en mente aperturar  una tienda dedicada a la venta de abarrotes, pues considera que es momento de crecer y que mejor oportunidad para hacer realidad su objetivo. Lleva consigo 03 créditos que ha usado para invertirlos, dándole la posibilidad no solo cumplir sus cuotas con total puntualidad sino también el lograr obtener buenos resultados de su inversión , a su vez también agradece  a su banco comunal por la manera como viene trabajando. Con los 2,000 soles otorgados iniciará su negocio de abarrotes en donde realizará la compra de algunos víveres, cereales y frutas cumpliendo así uno de sus objetivos a corto plazo.
texts.en: Gudilia is 33 and is the single mother of two children:  Katherine, 11, and Antonio, 5.  Together they form their family.  A short time ago, she was given the title to her property, which is made out of wood.  As the driven mother of the family, she decided 10 years ago to face life and established a fruit business through purely her own efforts.  She would make it into a good souce of income for her family, working alone and having the best support possible from her children.  On the other hand, she is thinking about opening a store dedicated to selling groceries,.  She thinks that it is time to grow and to have the best opportunity to reach her goal.  She has had 3 loans, which she has invested.  She has made all of her payments on time and also achieved good results from her investments.  She is also thankful to her communal bank for the way that it works.  She will use the 2,000 PEN to start her grocery business.  She will buy supplies, cereals, and fruits to fulfill her short-term goals.

loans.use: to buy supplies, cereals, and candy.

loans.name: Phelogona

texts.en: Phelogona is grateful for the support she is getting from Yehu and Kiva. Since the previous loan, she says that her business has grown and she hopes that it will continue to grow. Phelogona is a hardworking person who always struggles to succeed in life. Now that her business is producing good results, she has decided to expand it to earn more profits. With the loan she is requesting she plans to purchase more bales of clothes for sale.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:
This is Bienvenida. She previously accessed an 14,000 PHP loan that she used to buy herbal medicines and food supplements to sell. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 16,000 PHP loan for her to buy more herbal medicines and food supplements that she will sell to her customers. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Bienvenida hopes to expand soon, she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of herbal supplies and products needed in her business

loans.name: Tung

texts.en: Tung is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products such as shampoos, shower-gel and tooth-paste to restock his general store. This purchase will help him to better meet the needs of his customers. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business and offer his customers a greater variety of products. He hopes that his new loan will assist him in increasing the size of his store and increase sales and will also help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of basic goods to stock his general store

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong is requesting a new loan to buy shampoos, cosmetics and soft drinks, to serve her customers. Huong's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy shampoos, cosmetics, and soft drinks to serve customers

loans.name: Batbaatar

texts.en: Mr. Batbaatar is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two children in an apartment in Arhangai province, Mongolia. His wife, Tserenchimeg, is 37 years old. She works as an accountant in a private company. His daughter, Munhjin, is 6 years old. His son, Temujin, is 1 year old. They go to kindergarten. Mr. Batbaatar is planning to open a dental clinic. His profession is dentistry. He worked as a dentist in Japan for 10 years. He is a hardworking and responsible man. He is asking for 4,000,000 MNT to buy an X-ray machine and raw materials for artificial teeth for his business.

loans.use: to buy an X-ray machine and raw materials for artificial teeth for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes for her clothes-selling business.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Hang is requesting a new loan to buy better quality food to serve her customers. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy better quality food to serve her customers

loans.name: Jepun Sari Group

texts.en:
Like many Balinese women, Ni Ketut and the other members of the Jepun Sari group raise pigs in their yards to supplement their families’ incomes. Though many women support their families in this way, they may not know the best way to raise pigs to maximize income. Ni Ketut hopes that, through the MUK Pig Breeder Loan program, she will not only get capital but will also get training from MUK on the best way to feed and care for pigs.

Ni Ketut will use her share of the loan to purchase piglets and pig feed. She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as fattening pigs. With her profits, she will help support her family by supplementing the income of her husband, who works as a farmer. Ultimately, Ni Ketut hopes that increased income will enable her to purchase more pigs.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Virgincita

texts.en: Virgincita is 55 years old, married, and a resident of Kinuman Norte, Ozamis City, Philippines. She has 11 children. She has managed a gardening business as her source of income for 2 years. Every month, she earns PHP 4,000 from this activity. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,500 from GDMPC to purchase fertilizers. Virgincita hopes to expand the business, buy a motorcycle to easily move the goods in the marketplace, and obtain more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes for her clothes-selling business.

loans.name: Clemente

texts.es:
Clemente de 43 años un gran hombre y padre de sus 3 hijas, junto a su pareja Isabel dieron mucho de si para brindarles lo que hasta hoy han logrado que es inculcarles los valores y principios de superación. Uno de sus logros reflejados es el haber culminado la construcción de su casa. Hábil en el campo automotriz se desempeña como mecánico desde hace 15 años, inicialmente como empleado el cual le valió para ganar experiencia y confianza. Actualmente posee su propio taller con el apoyo administrativo de su pareja. 
Desde que se inicio fue muy perseverante en su trabajo llegando incluso a no desprenderse de sus labores hasta culminarlas. Esto le permitió conocer amistades los cuales serian en adelante sus futuros clientes  con quienes trabaja hasta hoy y le permiten hacer de su negocio su mejor herramienta para el progreso.
Dentro de sus prioridades planea adquirir mayor cantidad de repuestos para desempeñar sus labores con fluidez, debido a que el campo automotriz va en aumento así como su clientela. De esta manera seguirá trabajando para lograr que su negocio siga creciendo para hacer posible, solo administrarlo en el futuro según cuenta entusiasmado. Este es su crédito número 16 y como siempre agradece por confianza que MFP le brindó desde un inicio invirtiéndolo con seguridad, comenta también que le da gusto trabajar de codo a codo con sus compañeros de su banco comunal ya que también los ve  progresar.
Los 2,000 soles los destinará a la compra de repuestos para vehículos con el fin de tener su taller bien abastecido.
texts.en: Clemente is 43 years old and has three daughters. He and his wife, Isabel, have given their all to provide their children with the values and principles to move up in life. One of those achievements is reflected by having completed the construction of their home. Skilled in the automotive field, Clemente has made a living as a mechanic for the past 15 years. He started out as an employee, which helped him gain valuable experience and confidence. He currently has his own shop, which his wife helps administer. Since he started, he has been very persistent with his work and never let up until the job was done. This allowed him to make friends, who became future customers he has worked with ever since, and made his business the biggest tool he has to make progress. One of his priorities is to acquire more spare parts in order to carry out his work more fluidly, since his clientele is increasing. In this way he will keep working so his business will be able to keep growing, and he will run it with the same enthusiasm in the future. This is his 16th loan, and as always he is grateful for the confidence Kiva partner MFP has put in him since he started investing in his business. He also says that he likes working with his fellow members of his community bank because he can see the progress. He plans to use the loan to purchase parts so he can keep his shop well supplied.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en: Ana Marie is a married woman from Baclayon, Bohol. She has been in the lumber business for almost one year. She earns 8,000 PHP a month by working the lumber business. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchased more wood like coconut. On the other hand, Ana Marie is also engaged in a food vending business and she plans to buy more meat and vegetables. In the future, Ana Marie would like to expand her business to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy wood for her lumber business and to buy meat and vegetables for food vending.

loans.name: Piling Subur Group

texts.en:
The Piling Subur Group is formed from information received by Ni Ketut, who received it from a friend who had already joined the group of pig farmers assisted by MUK. Ni Ketut and her friends form a group to get a loan from MUK and training; so that they could keep pigs properly and in a manner consistent with the standards.

The loan will be used to purchase piglets, renovate the barn and buy feed. Most members of the group still keep pigs in the traditional way so they do not get the maximum results. By joining MUK's pig program, they expect to be able to increase their knowledge and the results obtained will be maximal.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, renovate the barn and buy feed.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She is 28 years old, married, and has 2 children. She is from Masabud, Clarin and has been in farming for six years, earning an amount of 7,000 PHP a month. In 2011, Maribel joined GDMPC. Maribel is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar, 24, is a young mother of two children. She is a hard-working wife and mother who owns and manages an accessories stand. She has been operating this business for four years and she aims to lift their standard of living through her started source of income.

She is determined to work hard because her husband can not help her to financially support their family, due to an unexpected motorcycle accident that happened to him. But life must go on, Maricar said. To continue her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 as additional capital. It will be used to buy more accessories, and stock up on plastic and kitchenwares to re-sell. She believes that through this loan she will increase her product offerings and satisfy her customers' needs. She hopes that in the future she will make the business a viable source of income, to save for the future of her two children.

loans.use: to buy more accessories, and stock up on plastic and kitchenwares to re-sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 36 years old and married with two school-aged children. She has a bakery shop where she sells variety breads in the community. Marilyn has had this business for almost two years and she earns approximately PHP 5,000 monthly. She is requesting a loan of PHP 9,000 to purchase flour, margarine, sugar, salt, and oil. She hopes that through the loan, she will acquire more customers and gain more income. In the future, Marilyn hopes that her business will improve to support the needs of her family, especially the educational needs of her two children.

loans.use: to purchase flour, margarine, sugar, salt, and oil

loans.name: La Flor Del Cafe Group

texts.es:
Don Jose, tiene 52 años de edad, tiene 6 hijos, y vive en una comunidad rural del municipio de nueva frontera, Santa Bárbara. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura, tiene aproximadamente 30 años de tener sus propios cultivos de café, maíz y frijoles. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local. El quiere tener una finca grande y mejorar la producción para tener un crecimiento económico.
Actualmente quiere darle mantenimiento a sus terrenos para continuar trabajando y ha decidido formar un grupo que se llama La flor del café y está formado por cuatro personas que en la foto se identifican así: a la izquierda esta don Jose, le sigue Ángel de camisa roja, luego esta Josue y a la derecha esta Isrrael, todos viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican  a la agricultura y el préstamo grupal es por 21,000 Lempiras, el préstamo lo utilizaran para comprar fertilizantes y abonos para darle un mejor mantenimiento  a los terrenos y lograr sacar mejores cosechas.
texts.en:
Jose, 52, has 6 children and lives in a rural community in the municipality of Nueva Frontera, in the department of Santa Barbara.  Jose has worked in agriculture all of his life.  He's been growing his own coffee, corn and bean crops for about 30 years.  He sells his crops in the local market.  He wants to have a big farm and improve his production so that he can have economic growth.

At this time, Jose wants to maintain his land so that he can keep on working.  He decided to form a communal bank called "La Flor del Cafe."  This group has 4 members who are identified in the photo as follows:  at the left is Jose, beside him in the red shirt is Angel, next is Josue, and at the far right is Isrrael.  They all live in the same community and are all farmers.  This group loan is for 21,000 Honduran lempiras.  They will use this loan to buy fertilizers and manure to maintain their land so that they can obtain better harvests.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure to maintain the farms where they grow coffee, corn and beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy eggs, plantains and yams.

loans.name: Sandra Milena
