In order to better serve his growing clientele, he decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, of which he has now been a member for four years. With this, his second loan, Nèkè plans to buy two electric irons, an ironing board and a Jakarta motorcycle. The motorcycle will allow him to pick up and deliver clothes to his customers that are further away from his workshop.

Nèkè hopes to earn a monthly income of 175,000 FCFA. He will use his income primarily to contribute to family expenses, and to pay the interest on his loan. The remainder he plans to use to re-invest in his business.

loans.use: to buy two electric irons, an ironing board, and a Jakarta motorcycle for making laundry deliveries.

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
17 mujeres de la ciudad de Encarnación han trabajado juntas y este es su cuarto ciclo. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, que día a día quieren superarse y ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Julia, quien se dedica a lavar prendas. Ella es lavandera y comenta que está muy orgullosa de lo que hace, ya que gracias a este trabajo está saliendo adelante ya que es un trabajo digno y honesto.
Solicita esta ayuda para poder invertirlo en la compra de jabón en polvo, en barra, suavizante para prenda y demás, ya que estos son los insumos que más necesita para poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Seventeen women in the city of Encarnación have worked together and are in their fourth loan cycle.  They're mothers and heads of household who want to improve themselves and help their families every day.

One of the group members is Julia, who makes a living washing clothes.  She comments that she's very proud of what she does because she's getting ahead thanks to this honorable and honest job.

She's requesting this loan to be able to buy soap powder, bar soap, fabric softener, and other supplies that are what she needs most to be able to continue working.

loans.use: to buy soap powder, bar soap, fabric softener, and other supplies

loans.name: Mungu Iko Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kyakimwa, conseillère de l’association de crédit « Mungu iko », est un entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de 36 ans, mère de 5 enfants qui étudient tous. Son mari est un petit commissionnaire, sans emploi fixe. Elle est vendeuse des boissons (Primus, Fanta). Elle installe ses marchandises dans son petit Kiosque. Elle commença son business avec son fonds propre reçu de son conjoint. Plus tard, elle bénéficia un fond additionnel de crédit de base  de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 5 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités pour la survie de sa famille. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser 18 cycles en profitant du programme de microcrédit de l’IMF Hekima. L’insécurité due aux inciviques dans la ville constitue une menace pour le développement de ses activités. Ainsi, donc, pour ce cycle son crédit a été revue à la baisse. Ce nouveau prêt doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec la boisson (4 casiers de Primus, 3 casiers de Fanta, etc.). En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir et créer un bistro. La cliente salut l’initiative de Hekima pour ses actions dédiées à l’autonomisation des femmes non bancables.
texts.en: Kyakimwa, who is the counsellor of the Mungu iko credit association, is a dynamic businesswoman. She is 36 years old and mother of five children all of whom are students. Her husband is a small commission agent, who is without fixed employment. She sells drinks (Primus, Orange soda). She sets up her merchandise in her little kiosk. She started her business with her own money given to her by her husband. Later, she was the beneficiary of an additional sum from the IMF Hekima credit fund. She has been running these small businesses to assure her family's survival for over five years. However, she has now accomplished 18 loan cycles taking advantage of the IMF Hekima micro credit programme. Insecurity due to incivilities in town constitutes a threat to the development of her business. Thus, for this reason this loan has been diminished. This new loan will enable her to stock up with drinks (4 crates of Primus, 3 crates of orange soda, etc.). In addition, she hopes to see her children grow up and to create a bistro. This client pays tribute to Hekima's initiative for their actions devoted to helping non bankable women to be autonomous.

loans.use: to buy drinks (4 crates of Primus, 3 crates of orange soda, etc.)

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Four years ago, Jameela started her own business, purchasing and selling cattle, with a loan from Kashf Foundation. Her husband is employed in a factory and earns a low salary. It was difficult for Jameela to manage all of the household expenditures with her husband's income. She then started her own business to contribute to the family income. She paid all her installments on time in previous loans. 

Jameela has one child, and she is happy to send him to a good school. She wants to build a good house for her family. She has some savings from her business and wants to purchase some cattle. So she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase some cattle and sell them near Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event). She hopes to get profit from it. She is thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase some cattle to sell

loans.name: Malik

texts.fr:
Né vers 1973 à Dioro, Monsieur Malik  est marié et père de quatre enfants.Il  habite avec sa famille à Sanoubougou I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso  (troisième région administrative de la république du mali) .
Monsieur Malik exerce les activités d’achat et de vente de Prêt à Porter depuis environ 14 ans et il dispose d’une boutique à la gare routière de Sanoubougou I. 
Vu l’augmentation de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses articles, il décida de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Avec ce cinquième prêt il compte acheter, 20 chemises différentes, 25 pantalons de qualité différentes, 20 paires de chaussure différentes (Soulier, Ferardine, etc.), 5 complets de veste, 20 Tee-Shirt et 15 complets de sous-vêtement. 
 Il s’approvisionne à Bamako afin de les revendre dans sa boutique située en pleine cœur de la gare routière de Sikasso avec une clientèle composée essentiellement de voyageurs et transporteurs.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 200 000 FCFA qui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce mais également d’honorer ses engagements à l’égard de Soro Yiriwaso et couvrir d’autres dépenses familles.
texts.en:
Born around 1973 in Dioro, Malik is married and a father of 4 children. He lives with his family in Sanoubougou I, one of the popular neighborhoods in the town of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Malik has been buying and selling ready-wear clothing for about 14 years. He has a shop at the Sanoubougou I bus terminal. 

Given the increase in customers, thanks to the quality of his clothing, Malik decided to collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. With this 5th loan, he expects to buy 20 different shirts, 25 pairs of trousers of various quality, 20 assorted pairs of shoes (dress shoes, Ferardine shoes, etc), 5 suits, 20 t-shirts, and 15 sets of underwear. He procures his goods in Bamako in order to resell them in his shop situated in the middle of the Sikasso bus terminal to a customer base made up largely of travelers and freight operators.

With this loan, he expects to earn an average monthly profit of 200,000 francs CFA, which will allow him to increase his business while equally honoring his commitments to Soro Yiriwaso and covering other family expenses.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Kennia Adelaida

texts.es: Kennia de estado civil soltera, tiene 1 hija mayor de edad .Kennia cuenta que comenzó con esta actividad por la falta de empleo que existe en el país ya que ella quería encontrar trabajo pero no encontró. Pues fue ahí entonces que decidió vender  todo lo referente a las ventas y lo que más le llamo la atención fue los cosméticos y le ha ido muy bien, la cual trabaja en las tardes a ofrecer a sus vecinos los productos que posee. Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda. Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar .perfume, cremas, colonias, desodorantes, talcos etc.
texts.en:
Kennia is single and has one adult daughter. Kennia says that she started this work because of the lack of employment that exists in the country, as she wanted to find work but couldn't.

It was then that she decided to consider all the different areas related to sales. What most caught her attention was cosmetics, and it has gone very well. She works in the afternoons to provide her neighbors with the products she has. 

Her dream is make improvements to her home.

With the loan, she wishes to buy perfume, creams, colognes, deodorants, powders, etc.

loans.use: To buy perfume, creams, colognes, deodorants, powders etc.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en: Shameem is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of two. Four years ago, she started her own business buying and selling goats because the income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses. She started her business with the support of Kashf Foundation and purchased different animals for sale. She has been in association with Kashf Foundation for four years and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She desires to give her children a better future and the necessary education so they will succeed in life. For this purpose she wants to increase her business income and has applied a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy more goats in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy more goats to sell

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus, 26, is a single gentleman who runs a kiosk, selling basic items like flour, beans, salt and cooking fat, among others. He has one year of experience in this business, and this has made him very familiar with sales, which enables him to obtain the best profits. The kiosk is located in his home in an area that has heavy foot traffic, and he has obtained a lot of customers.

Justus is a man committed to his work, and he feels proud of what he has achieved to date. He is keen to continue along his path and make every effort as he knows that in the end he will obtain a great reward: success. He needs capital to stock his kiosk with basic goods, which is why he is seeking a loan from Yehu to allow him to buy bales of flour, instant products, sweets, bread, etc.

loans.use: to buy bales of flour, instant products, sweets, bread, etc.

loans.name: Norberto

texts.es: Norberto de treinta y nueve años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia; él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura  y se ha hecho de valiosa experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas; el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona de alto potencial agrícola, con suelo fértil y muy cercano a su vivienda, comercia en los alrededores de la localidad y ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefiere por los buenos precios, el producto de calidad y el excelente servicio; Norberto es un hombre alegre, emprendedor, dedicado a su labor, todos los días se entrega por completo a su trabajo pues ama lo que hace y sabe que eso lo conducirá al éxito, en la ultima temporada de siembra tuvo algunas perdidas y quiere recuperarse, necesita invertir y por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un credito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, insecticida, herbicida, herramienta, etc. Norberto tiene buenas referencias de pago y es responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía  que le dara a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Norberto, 39, lives with his life companion and their children in his own house.  He works growing corn and beans; he’s been working in agriculture for several years and has gained valuable experience that makes it possible for him to get good crop yields.   His parcel of farmland is located in an area with fertile soil of high agricultural potential that’s near his house.  He sells all around the location and has many customers who prefer him for the good prices, quality products and excellent service.

Norberto is a cheerful, enterprising man who is dedicated to his work.  He gives his all to his work every day because he loves what he does and knows it will lead him to success.   He had some losses last growing season and he wants to recuperate.  He needs to invest which is why he’s asking Integral for a loan to buy corn and bean seeds, insecticide, herbicide, tools, etc.  Norberto has good payment references and is responsible.  He assures that he will be able to repay the loan while at the same time trusts that he will give his family better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn and bean seeds, insecticide, herbicide and tools.

loans.name: Florencia Georgina

texts.es: Georgina de estado civil divorciada, tiene hijos. Georgina Cuenta que comenzó con esta actividad por la falta de empleo que existe en el país ya que ella quería encontrar trabajo pero no encontró y a raíz que su ex esposo la abandono ella tuvo que luchar para llevar el pan de cada dia  a su hogar por eso Georgina  desde ese entonces que decidió vender todo lo referente a cosméticos y le ha ido muy bien, la cual trabaja en las tardes a ofrecer a sus vecinos los productos que posee. Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar: perfume, cremas, colonias, desodorantes, talcos etc.
texts.en: Georgina’s divorced and has three children.  She relates that she started this activity because of the lack of employment in the country; she wanted to find a job but couldn’t and because her husband abandoned her she had to struggle to put bread on the table and this is why Georgina decided from that moment on to sell everything related to cosmetics and she’s done very well.  She works afternoons offering the products she has to her neighbors.  She wants to use the loan to buy perfume, cream, cologne, deodorant, talc, etc.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cream, cologne, deodorant, talc, etc.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva is married with five children, three of whom attend school.  She also takes care of additional family members (old parents).  She has a retail shop and has applied for a loan of 1500000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more items (sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil, maize, flour, and rice).  She sells retail to many people seven days a week at the market.  Her major business challenges include transportation of commodities (from Kikuubo in Kampala city to her shop) and the ever-increasing prices of commodities in Uganda.  She aspires to see her business grow into a wholesale shop and also to buy a delivery van to make transportation easier.  She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, cooking oil, maize, flour, and rice.

loans.name: Nani

texts.en:
Nani is from Lanchkhuti district of West Georgia. She is 49 years old and lives with her husband and two grown sons. Her elder son works at cleaning services and the younger is a logistic at the kindergarten. Nani runs the agricultural business. In particular, she has two milk cows for dairy products. The family grows nuts and maize on the family-owned land. In addition, the family has a pig, eleven piglets and bee hives with bee colonies,which give them honey.  Nani sells her agricultural products at the local open market.

She has requested a loan to purchase agricultural land. The land has a profitable location for her bee-keeping business and Nani will arrange bee-hives there to increase their productivity.  This will give her an opportunity to expand the family business and get an increased income.  She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural land and place bee-hives there.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana Julia de cuarenta y siete años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos; ella se dedica al cultivo de cereales, frijoles, maíz, entre otros, tiene varios años de trabajar en el rubro y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y cercano a su vivienda, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y el servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes; Ana es una mujer dedicada a su labor, responsable y emprendedora, dia a dia lucha por un futuro mas prospero y no piensa rendirse hasta lograr el éxito que desea, en la ultima temporada de siembra aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para aumentar la producción por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL  un credito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, insecticida, herbicida etc. Ana Julia tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dara a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana Julia, 47, lives with her life partner and her children. She has been growing beans and corn, among other cereals for many years, which has given her a lot of experience and the ability to obtain the best crops.

Her fields are located in an agricultural area, close to where she lives. She sells her products in the surrounding area of her community, and she has now many customers that choose her products because of their quality and good prices, and because she provides an unparalleled service, always listening to their needs.

Ana is a hard-working woman, responsible and enterprising. She strives every day for a better future and she will continue to do so until she succeeds. During the last sowing season, the demand increased and she wants to take the opportunity to increase production. This is why she is requesting a loan at INTEGRAL, in order to be able to buy corn seeds, bean seeds, insecticide, herbicide and other supplies.

Ana Julia has good references and impeccable morals. She assures that she will be able to pay the loan and at the same time she is confident that she will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, bean seeds, insecticide and herbicide.

loans.name: Abduaziz

texts.ru: Абдуазиз обратился в МДО "Арванд", чтобы  привезти осенний товар.  Он досрочно погасив свой предыдущий кредит решил получить очередной кредит.  Он торгует на рынке мужской и детской обувью. Скоро начинается  сезон дождей и холодов торговля  пойдет  хорошо, поэтому он решил привезти товар. Его жена поддерживает его в бизнесе, когда Абдуазиз уезжает за товаром, она сидит за прилавком и торгует.   Его дети еще молоды, старшему 12 лет а младшему 5 лет. Он копит свои средства, для будущих своих детей. Старший сын мечтает поступить в престижный университет и стать врачом.  Поэтому Абдуазиз, хочет получить кредит чтобы улучшить свой ассортимент и привезти осенний товар, и тем самым увеличить свой капитал и доход.
texts.en: Abduaziz came to MDO Arvand to bring in autumn merchandise.  He repaid his previous loan early and decided to obtain another loan.  He sells men's and children's shoes at a market.  The rainy and cold season is starting soon, and sales will go well.  This is why Abduaziz decided to bring in merchandise now.  His wife supports him in the business and sits behind the counter and sells when he travels for merchandise.  His children are still small - the oldest is 12 and the youngest is 5 years old.  He is saving money for his children's future.  The oldest son dreams of getting accepted to a prestigious university and becoming a doctor.  This is why Abduaziz wants to obtain a loan to improve his selection and bring in autumn merchandise, and, thus, increase his capital and income.

loans.use: to purchase autumn merchandise

loans.name: Yerson Alfredo

texts.es: Alfredo nació en la ciudad de Huayllabamba pero ahora vive en la ciudad de Huayocari de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, él tiene 28 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, él se dedica a la ganadería y la agricultura pues es una herencia de sus padres pero él también trabaja como chofer de maquinaria pesada para una entidad pública y le va muy bien, él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar abano entre otras cosas, él pertenece al banco comunal “Pro Mujer De Huayocari” de la Asociación Arariwa pues es una persona responsable.
texts.en:
Yerson Alfredo was born in the city of Huayllabamba, but now lives in the city of Huayocari in the province of Calca, in Cusco department. He's 28 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children. He raises livestock and farms, as he inherited land from his parents, but he also works as a heavy equipment operator for the state entity, and it is going very well. 

On this occasion, he needs the loan to buy fertilizer and other supplies. He belongs to the "Pro Mujer de Huayocani" communal bank of Asociación Arariwa, as he is a responsible person.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de postales que junto con su esposo venden en forma inpendiente,la socia tambien sigue trabajando enseñando a niños del nivel primario,la socia vende los postales desde las 3:00 p.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,y en las mañanas trabaja enseñando niños,la socia ya tiene 6 años en su negocio de venta de posteles,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde puede vender los postales.La socia solicita le credito para comprar materiales para las postales como papeles y pinturas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She continues working selling post-cards that she and her husband sell independently.  She also continues working as an elementary school teacher.  She sells post-cards from 3pm to 7pm and works mornings teaching children.  She’s been in the post-card selling business for six years.  Her dream is to have a locale wherein to sell her post-cards.  She requests the loan to buy materials like paint and paper for the post-cards.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy paint and paper.

loans.name: Johana Vanessa

texts.es: Johana tiene 43 años de edad estado civil divorciada, tiene 2 hijos que estudian en una escuela publica. Desde que era muy joven Johana su madre le enseño lo que la confección de ropa eso a ella le encanto por lo que ahora ese es su  trabajo ella comenzó con una maquina en su casa y poco a poco ha ido creciendo su negocio, la cual elabora camisas, pantalones. Por eso con el préstamo ella quiere comprar cosas como: hilo, tela y otra máquina de coser etc.
texts.en: Johana, 43, is divorced and has two children attending public school.  Since she was very young Johana’s mother taught her dressmaking and she loved it.  This is now her occupation.  She started out with a sewing machine at home and the business has gradually been growing.  She makes shirts and pants.  She wants the loan to buy such things as thread, fabric, another sewing machine, etc.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric, another sewing machine, etc.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
Samuel es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de su madre ocupando solo una habitación, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona La Merced en la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja por más de diez horas ala día y a veces toda la noche en una empresa privada y con lo que gana debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia ya que vive con su madre que esta delicada de salud y es mayor de edad.
El crédito lo requiere para compra de arena, cemento, ladrillos, ya que desea refaccionar la entrada principal de su casa para tener más seguridad.
El sueño de Samuel es mejorar sus ingresos y poder ser más independiente para tener más comodidad y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Samuel is single and has no children.  He lives in his mother’s house occupying a single bedroom.  The house is located in the city of La Paz’s La Merced zone.  He currently works more than 10 hours daily and sometimes all night for a private firm and uses what he earns to cover food and basic utility costs for his family since he lives with his mother and she’s in poor health and of advanced age.

He needs the loan to buy sand, cement and bricks because he wants to reinforce the house’s main entrance in order to have better security.  Samuel’s dream is to improve his income in order to be more independent and have more comfort and improve his quality of life.  This is the second time he’s worked with Impro and first with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement and sand to reinforce his mother's house's main entrance.

loans.name: Mirabel Akwi

texts.en:
She was born in 1985 and she is married with two children. She lives in Bamenda, North West region of Cameroon, with her two children.

She has encountered a good number of challenges in her life which include: She dropped out of school because there was no money to continue paying for her school fees. Ill health has also been a serious problem in her family, even to the extent of her losing family members. 

Notwithstanding the above mentioned difficulties, she also suffers from inadequate capital to start up and run a small business of her own which will enable her to cater for her children’s school fees, rent, bills and others. With this loan she intends to buy day-old chicks and feed. Her activity will assist her community, providing them with chicken during festivity periods.

With the proceed from this loan she will educate her children and cater for her children’s hospital bills, ploughing back profit and expanding her business and increasing her savings for difficult days. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the gradual installment payments and the low interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase day old chicks and feed

loans.name: Eyvaz

texts.en:
Eyvaz is a 53 year old man, who is married and has one son. He is a sheep breeder and has 20 head of sheep in his herd. He has 16 years of experience in this field.   His wife is a housekeeper, who keeps house and helps her husband to look after sheep. He also has a garden where he raises seasonal fruits and vegetables. 

The village where Eyvaz lives is located in the southern part of Azerbaijan, which has very rigorous climate conditions. In the summer the temperature reaches 105 degrees fahrenheit.  The main problem in the region is water for irrigation and for animals.  Eyvaz is not able to build a water channel for his garden alone. This is quite an expensive process which requires a labor force and special equipment.   When he heard about water loans, he was extremely excited and applied for a 2000 AZN loan. He will use this loan to pay for special equipment, like a tractor for making a water channel, and to hire workers who will dig the land.

He is a trustworthy client of AqroInvest and has a good client history.

loans.use: to pay for special equipment and to hire people

loans.name: Eldaniz

texts.en:
Eldaniz is a 35-year-old farmer who keeps 30 head of sheep and raises wheat. He has 14 years of experience in this field. He is single and his brother and mother help him to run the business. His monthly income is 300 AZN and he has only one wish now--to pipe water to his fields and to his house. Now to water his cows he pastures them to about 1 kilometer to the nearest river. 

When he heard about water loans he was extremely excited and applied for a 2000 AZN loan. Making a water channel is quite an expensive process which requires a labor force and special equipment. He will use this loan to pay for renting special equipment like a tractor for making a water channel and for workers who will dig the land. This will be his fifth loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to pay for special equipment rental and for hiring laborers to make a water channel

loans.name: Sando

texts.en: Sando is 35-years old and resides with her husband and three children at Paynesville South.  Her children are between the ages of 2 and 15 and two of the children are in school.  She has a table in the market where she sells rice, onions, pepper, palm oil, black pepper, and salt for the past six years.  She first started by selling mineral water.  Because she always has what her customers need, she make a profit when she sells.  She has requested her third loan to purchase more palm oil, pepper, salt, onion, and rice in order to increase her sales.  Her future plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase food items for resale.

loans.name: Bencolleter

texts.en:
Bencolleter is a 43-year-old married woman. She has two children, ages 15 years and 23 years. She describes herself to be a social and talkative woman.

She operates a tailoring retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located near an urban area and her primary customers are residents from the environs. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. 

She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy clothes materials for making clothes for selling. Her business goal is to improve her business and create job opportunities for people within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials for making clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Doña María es la propietaria de un restaurante ubicado en la hermosa ciudad de Bogotá, el cual inició desde el año 1980, cuando observó que en el sector donde estaba ubicada, no existía este tipo de negocios y había muchos trabajadores que no encontraban un lugar cercano para desayunar y almorzar. Fue así,  como decidida inició su emprendimiento,  ofreciendo desayunos,  a los que poco a poco agregó almuerzos diarios, como comidas corrientes y los fines de semana platos especiales, instalada en un local ubicado en su domicilio. Para doña Maria, su día de trabajo lo inicia desde las 4 de la mañana y termina su actividad a las 3:30 de la tarde. Sus principales clientes son profesores de los colegios distritales cercanos y vecinos que conocen la calidad con que prepara los alimentos y a los que les ahorra la preparación especialmente en  los fines de semana. En la actualidad su sueño de crecimiento no se detiene y sabe que necesita ofrecer una mayor variedad de menús diarios, para consolidarse en el sector, y permanecer muy competitiva y por eso planea agregar el servicio domicilio y más adelante crear otro punto donde vender sus alimentos preparados. En su experiencia de 32 años, conoce que necesita invertir y los créditos son una alternativa de crecimiento empresarial, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual comprará mesas, para aumentar sus clientes en la potencialidad del barrio y comprar en mayor volumen materias primas e insumos, como carnes frutas, verduras y bebidas refrescantes que complementen los deliciosos platos, que en el restaurante de Doña María se ofrecen en un ambiente confortable que agrada a su clientela y a la que ella quiere fidelizar.
texts.en:
Maria is the owner of a restaurant located in the beautiful city of Bogotá. 

She started this business in 1980, when she observed that the location did not have this type of business, and there were many workers did not have a nearby place to eat breakfast and lunch. It was then she began as an entrepreneur, offering breakfast to those who little by little began eating lunch as well. She served ready-to-eat meals and special weekend dishes in her home. 

Maria begins work from 4:00 in the morning until 3:30 in the afternoon. 

Her primary customers are teachers in the local district schools, neighbors who know the quality of the food well, and those who save up for meals especially on weekends. 

Currently, her dream of growth has not stopped. She knows she has to offer a greater variety in her daily menus in order to be successful and remain competitive. For this reason, she plans to add to her home service and later create another location to sell her prepared meals. 

In her 32 years of experience, she knows that she needs to invest, and that loans are an alternative way to grow a business. This is the reason why she is requesting a loan, the first made by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. 

She will use the loan to buy tables, to increase the number of customers from the neighborhood, buy ingredients at wholesale pricing, like meat, fruits, vegetables, and soda, to complement her delicious meals. 

In Maria's restaurant, she offers a comfortable environment that pleases her customers so she can make them loyal ones.

loans.use: to buy tables, ingredients such as meat, fruit, vegetables, and soda.

loans.name: Jesus Alejandro

texts.es: Jesus de 35 años de edad, es el propietario de una tienda ubicada en su domicilio; él inicio su negocio, porque aprendió a trabajar independiente con la experiencia tradicional de su padre y su abuela. En su tienda, Jesus vende artículos de la canasta familiar, como ranchos, víveres, refrescos, y todos los productos que consumen las familias y que algunas comunidades solo pueden acceder a pequeñas porciones o al detal diariamente, de acuerdo a lo que ingresos que tenga cada hogar. En la tienda, sus principales clientes son las amas de casa vecinas y también visitantes del barrio, cuando necesitan responder a un deseo  o a una necesidad, que allí  pueden solucionar. Sus ventas son directas en mostrador y posee un punto comercial bien posicionado de mas de 20 años,  cuando sus padres y abuelos en él trabajaban y  que ahora él y su hermana reciben,  para que se desempeñen bien y tengan sus propios ingresos.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará, productos lácteos, enlatados, embutidos y artículos de miscelánea, para aprovechar con estos últimos artículos,  que se acercan las fiestas y la demanda en el mercado aumenta.   Con su anterior crédito con la Fundación, manifiesta que mejoraron las ventas de su negocio y que este se ha fortalecido aun mas y es lo que justamente espera al invertir su credikiva, pues diversificará y le apuntará a vender cada vez mas, en el segundo semestre del año, donde usualmente las ventas de todos los productos, ocupan el pico mas alto de su cima.
texts.en:
Jesús is 35 years old and is the owner of a store located in his home. He started his business because he learned to work independently with the traditional experience of his father and grandmother. In his store, Jesús sells articles from the basic food basket, such as snacks, staple foods, drinks, and all products consumed by households. Some communities only have access to small portions or products in retail daily, depending on the income of each household. 

In the store, his main customers are neighboring housewives and also neighborhood visitors when they need to respond to a desire or a need, which can be solved there. His sales are direct at the counter and he has a point of sale well-positioned after more than 20 years, when his parents and grandparents worked there. Now, he and his sister work there, so they can do their job well and earn their own income.

Currently, he is applying for a Kiva loan, first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will buy dairy products, canned goods, cold meat, and miscellaneous items. With the last items he wants to take advantage of the Holidays, when market demand increases.

With his previous loan with the Foundation, he says he improved sales of his business, which has strengthen it even more. This is exactly what he expects about this Kiva loan investment, to diversify and to sell more and more in the second half of the year, when the sales of all products usually increase to the highest peak.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, canned goods, cold meat and miscellaneous items,

loans.name: Cruz Magdalena

texts.es: Cruz tiene 56 años estado civil casada. Tiene hijos mayores de edad. Cruz cuenta que tuvo que ver la manera de cómo generar dinero a su casa por la falta de empleo que existe en el país. La cual  tomo la decisión  de ponerse una tienda en su casa de venta de bebidas como: gaseosas, agua. El negocio a ella le está resultando muy por lo que su sueño es surtir más su tienda. Con el préstamo  Cruz comprara, bebidas, víveres, arroz, aceite etc.
texts.en: Cruz is 56 years old, single, and has adult children. Cruz says that she had to find a way to generate money for the household due to the lack of employment that exists in the country. So she made the decision to set up a store in her home, and sell drinks such as soft drinks and water. With the loan, Cruz will buy drinks, groceries, rice, cooking oil, etc.

loans.use: To buy drinks, groceries, rice, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Anwer

texts.en:
Anwer is a 45-year-old married woman and mother of seven children. She is in the milk-selling business and most of her clients are her neighbors.  She makes enough to lead a decent life. Her husband and a son run a Rikshaw (auto) business in town and one son works as a power loan worker. Five other children attend school. The circle of her family is running through four breadwinners. 

She is in charge of providing her family with good food and also providing for their health and education. She has slowly but surely improved her business with a loan from the Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy another cow to meet the increasing demands of her customers. The combination of  her loan and savings would enable her to purchase another cow. She hopes to have more profits and better support her family. She will spend a portion of the profit earned on the better education of her children.

loans.use: to buy another cow to meet the increasing demands of her customers.

loans.name: Shama

texts.en: A few years ago, Shama started a beauty parlor in a room that had been used for storage. She utilized this neglected part of her home for a productive purpose as she knew that her family needed extra income. She also knew that her parents must also be collecting things for her marriage and she needed to support them. She works tirelessly to keep the business running. She told Kashf that it was getting extremely difficult to manage the family as the parlor was running on minimum necessities and clients were hesitant to use the services because of the shortage of necessary items. That’s when she took a loan of RS 20,000 from Kashf and said that she will be investing in buying utensils, cosmetics, creams and makeup kits. She is hopeful to increase her income by facilitating more customers at a time.

loans.use: to buy utensils, cosmetics, creams and makeup kits in larger quantity.

loans.name: Baxsheyish

texts.en:
Baxsheyish is 63 years old and on a pension. He breeds cows for milk purposes and has 20 years of experience in this field. He is married and has one son who helps him run the business. He has regular customers and his business brings him a stable income of 150 AZN. However, there is only one problem he has which is the lack of water. Several years ago he bought land for cultivating vegetables, but it is still unused because there was no water for irrigation. Meanwhile, to water his cows, he pastures them at the nearest river about 1 kilometer away. 

When he heard about water loans he was extremely excited and applied for a 2000 AZN loan. Building a water channel is quite an expensive process which requires labor and special equipment.  He will use this loan to pay for special equipment rentals, like a tractor, to build the water channel and for workers who will dig the land. This will be his second loan and he has good client history.

loans.use: to pay for special equipment to rent and for labor.

loans.name: Josprinter

texts.en: Josprinter is a 31-year-old married woman with 5 children.  She describes herself to be social and talkative.  She operates a retail business where she sells baskets.  She has been involved in this business for 10 years.  Her business is located near an urban area and her primary customers are residents from environs.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds to improve the business.  She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy baskets to resell.  Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years.  She hopes that in the future she will educate her children.  Josprinter is also a farmer and she practices farming during her leisure time for additional income.  This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more baskets to resell.

loans.name: Kalidou

texts.fr:
Né vers 1983 à Sikasso, Monsieur  Kalidou est célibataire et réside chez son père dans une grande famille traditionnelle à Médine, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso.
Kalidou s’est très vite initié depuis plus de deux années à cette activité d’achat et vente des téléphones portables et leurs accessoires (façade, batterie, chargeur, écouteur, etc.) Son activité est menée dans sa boutique située aux abords d'une route très fréquentée avec une clientèle composée de toutes les couches sociales. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Il décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant douze mois.
Il sollicite ce deuxième crédit qui lui permettant d’acheter à Bamako 15 DVD, 8 téléviseurs, 45 téléphones portables de marques différentes, 5 cartons de façade, une quinzaine de chargeurs, 25 paquets de carte mémoire, 15 cartons de batterie et 12 douzaines d’écouteur de différentes sortes. 
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 275 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born around 1983 in Sikasso, Kalidou is single and lives with his father. They both live with their large traditional family in Medina, one of the popular districts in the city of Sikasso.

For over two years, Kalidou has been running his business buying and selling mobile phones and their accessories (face plates, batteries, chargers, earphones, etc.). He conducts his business in his own shop located on the side of a very busy road, and his clientele is composed of people from all walks of life. He is very sought after by his clients due to the high quality of the products he sells.

In order to better serve his ever-increasing customer base, twelve months ago Kalidou decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. He is on his second loan with the institution. With this loan, he plans go to Bamako (the capital of Mali) to purchase 15 DVDs, eight televisions, 45 mobile phones of different brands, five cartons of face plates, 15 phone chargers, 25 packs of memory cards, 15 cartons of batteries, and 12 dozen assorted earphones.

He hopes to earn a monthly income of 275,000 FCFA. This income will be used primarily to contribute to family expenses, to pay the interest on his loan and to re-invest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase DVDs, TVs, mobile phones and phone accessories for resale.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia nació en la ciudad de Huayocari y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. (El distrito de Huayocari pertenece a la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco), ella tiene 62 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene siete hijos, ella se dedica a la agricultura pues es una herencia de sus padres entonces ella siembra y cosecha verduras como por ejemplo zanahorias, brocoli, cebollas, habas y otras más para luego venderlas en uno de los mercados de la ciudad del Sicuani donde le va muy bien, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y para hacer trabajar los terrenos de cultivos, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Pro Mujer De Huayocari” de la Asociación Arariwa pues una persona responsable y colaboradora.
texts.en: Lucia was born in the city of Huayocari and lives in the same city where she was born. (The district of Huayocari is part of the province of Calca in the department of Cusco). She is 62 years old and is married, and as a result of this beautiful relationship has 7 children. She in in agriculture for a living as it is the heritage of her family. She plants and harvests vegetables such as carrots, broccoli, onions, lima beans and more, to later sell in one of the markets in the city of Sicuani where it is going very well. For this opportunity she is requesting a loan to buy seeds and to work to cultivate the land. She belongs to the communal bank "Pro Mujer De Huayocari" or "Pro Women of Huayocari" from the Arariwa Association as she is a collaborative and responsible person.

loans.use: to buy seeds and cultivate the land.
